loans.name: Shishikara Group

texts.fr:
Adelaïde  fait partie du groupe Shishikara  et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a 32 ans et est mariée à Julien, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 1 à 8  ans dont 2 étudient. 
Elle a sous sa charge 2 enfants orphelins qui étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de  boutique (farine de manioc, l’huile de palme, fretin) depuis 17 ans. 

Elle est à son cinquième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter 100 kg de farine de manioc et 50 kg de fretins  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, elle voudrait construire une  maison dans sa parcelle  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Adelaïde is member of the Shishikara Group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 32 years old and is married to Julien, a merchant. Together they have three children between the ages of one and eight years old, two of whom are studying. She has two dependents; orphaned children who are studying.

She is a merchant in a shop where she has been selling cassava flour, palm oil, and small fish for 17 years. Adelaïde is on her fifth loan cycle with Turame. With the loan she receives from KIVA, she plans to increase her capital and purchase 100 kg of cassava flour and 50 kg of small fish to sell so that she can earn more income.

In the coming years, she would like to build a house on her parcel of land and see her children continue their studies.

loans.use: to purchase 100 kg of cassava flour and 50 kg of small fish to resell.

loans.name: Zhoomart

texts.en:
Zhoomart is a student of the American University of Central Asia, Department of International and Comparative Politics, and here is his story.

“Every final year students choose their profession. Someone becomes an engineer and plans buildings, someone becomes a doctor and saves lives. Of course, all of those professions are important, but there is one which the whole country or even the world depends on. I think that one is politics. Politicians can change the world. They rule the past, present, and future.

"In fact, I realized that I started studying the subject of politics earlier than I thought before. In my secondary school, I was interested in international history. Especially, I was interested in politics and the political system of American politicians. 

"My favorite politician is Franklin Delano Roosevelt, 32nd president of the United States. I was impressed by his charm, influence, and firmness. Despite his disability, he was not afraid of difficulties and he always worked for his country’s interest. Also, he is the only president of the United States who was elected more than two times, he was elected four times. 

"Influenced by Franklin Delano Roosevelt, I started to get interested in the lives of politicians. In a short period of time, I have read many books, articles, and encyclopedias about famous politicians. So, I opened myself to the big and interesting world of politics. 

"Browsing through the information brochure and the University’s home page, I felt that undergraduate studying in AUCA can give me a lot. First, it has highly qualified professors with great educational background and working experience. They received their Masters degrees and PhDs in the United States. 

"After four years of studies at AUCA, I have a definite plan for my future, which is applying for a Masters degree from a university abroad. In order to know more about other political systems and build some experience, I will participate in extra activities such as debates, conferences, and other activities. I will also visit lectures of famous politicians and professors. I am really interested in political science and am ready to devote myself to this very area. 

"Taking an opportunity, I would like to apply for a Kiva loan, which is open to all AUCA students. I think it’s worth mentioning that this is another unique opportunity which AUCA gives to its students. I am happy to be part of such a great university.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education.

loans.name: Kiprotich

texts.en:
Kiprotich lives in the Kericho area of Kenya, which has a climate that is excellent for agriculture.  He has four children.  His primary income sources are milk and eggs.  He has been doing this work for five years.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming:  "Growing crops and rearing livestock.'" His biggest challenge is that farming is expensive. Animals on the farm have been given the name of "Cheboit."

Kiprotich was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "They have cheap rates."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "It gives increased income."

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit his family', Kiprotich replied, "'Improvement of livelihood."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Kiprotich owns the following:  a cow and poultry but not a pig, a pump, a bicycle, a motorcycle, or an automobile.  Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net and a TV' but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, or a DVD.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia lives in the Ndaragwa area of Kenya, which has one of the cooler climates in Kenya. She has five children, and their school fees are her highest monthly expense.

For the past ten years Teresia has worked as a farmer. Her primary income sources come from her crops and the milk and eggs she gets from her cows and chickens. As a farmer she gets her greatest enjoyment from selling her cows’ milk, while her biggest challenge is feeding the animals. 

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Teresia owns cows and chickens but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has mosquito net in the household but does not have a electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, TV or DVD player.

Teresia is applying for a 20,000 KES loan to build a dairy. When asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo to go to for a loan, Teresia said she felt it had better loan terms. She was also asked what she learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session. She answered that the guarantee enabled one to get a loan easily.

When asked how this loan would benefit her family, Teresia replied that she would be able to educate her children through increased milk profits.

loans.use: To build a dairy unit.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, where available land is scarce. His primary income sources are milk and eggs. He has two children and has been doing this work for four years.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Earnings gotten from it." His biggest challenge is that it is time consuming.  Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Omosigisi."

Joseph was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "It offers low interest."  He was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "They help people to improve their lives."

His highest monthly expense is school fees. Joseph says that this loan will help stabilize his family.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Joseph owns a cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, a pump, a bicycle, a motorcycle or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. Joseph has a mosquito net and electricity in his house, but does not have solar power, running water, a sewing machine, a TV, or a DVD player.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and water tank.

loans.name: Joni

texts.en:
Joni is a 28-year-old single man. He is a handyman who is working at a furniture workshop. 

To make more money, Joni is also running his own business:  a motorcycle-washing business. He started the business three months ago by using his own capital to buy the washing equipment and to rent a business place. In order to assist him in running the business, Joni  hired his relative to manage the business, as he must go to work at the furniture workshop every day. 

Recently, he has been building his own semi-permanent house, but he has limited money to buy more supporting material. This situation led him to go to TLM's office and apply for a loan amounting of IDR 12,000,000. The loan will be spent on teak planks and plywood for his house.

loans.use: to buy teak planks and plywood for his house.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a 31-year-old, married woman doing a business of selling milk with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. 

Azra has two cows in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to help her lead a decent life. 

She is a mother of five and she is very motivated to provide her children with a beautiful life, with good education, food, and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life.  

Now, Azra has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase one more cow. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk which, ultimately, helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 37 years old, married, and has four children who attend school. He lives in Kongowea, north of Mombasa, Kenya. He runs a fruit business in the local market, which he has been doing for more than 15 years. His business is growing. 

Paul is requesting a loan from Milango, which he will use to buy fruits to sell. He hopes that the business will expand in the next five years despite the usual challenge of competition from other traders. He will use the extra income to add stock to his business and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fruits

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 37-year-old, married woman who, for the past five years, has been running a business, selling milk with her husband. She has one calf and four cows in milk, which she uses to sell to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. 

Shahnaz has become famous for providing good-quality milk and she makes enough money to contribute to her family's income. She has six children, including five sons and one daughter, and she is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life, with good food and clothing. 

Shahnaz has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy one more cow. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her business.

loans.use: to buy one more cow.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Georgina did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. 

Currently, Georgina prepares and sells doughnuts in Twa (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 16 years. As a widow with 4 children, Georgina uses all her income to feed and provide for her family.

Georgina will use the loan to increase the quantity of flour, cooking oil, margarine and other ingredients which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Georgina wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, margarine and other ingredients which will aid her in improving her overall sales

loans.name: Raphik

texts.en: Raphik is single and has no children. Even though he did not receive any formal education, Raphik is a successful businessman. He sells secondhand bed sheet and towels  in Twa (near Cape Coast). He has been actively involved in this business for about two years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Raphik uses his income to provide for the entire family. Raphik will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of secondhand bed sheet and towels, thus aiding him to improve his overall sales. With the new profits from his expanded business, Raphik plans to further diversify the type of products that he sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of secondhand clothing, thus aiding him to improve his overall sales

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Esi is a food vender. She specializes in selling cooked rice in Twa (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for two years. 

Esi is married and has four children; her husband is a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Esi wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of cooked rice. 

In the long term, Esi plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of cooked rice

loans.name: Dado

texts.fr:
Madame Dado, une dame de 47 ans, mariée et mère de deux filles, s’active dans le commerce depuis plus de 20ans. Elle a très tôt embrassé le petit commerce ; en ce temps, elle vendait le plus souvent des perles et de l’encens. Voulant profiter des fêtes qui approchent, Dado décide de renouveler son crédit afin de pouvoir acheter des tissus et revendre pour la Tabaski, mais aussi continuer son activité de vente d’encens et de perles. Elle est active entre 9h et 13h et entre 16h et 19h. Elle fait de l’ambulant et donne dès fois ses services dans des cérémonies religieuses comme les baptêmes, les mariages… Avec les recettes de son activité, elle peut diversifier les produits et services et prendre en charge le petit déjeuner de ses enfants.
Puisqu’ayant que des enfants filles et que dans la culture africaine les filles sont destinée au mariage c'est-à-dire quitter  le domicile parental pour aller rejoindre le domicile conjugal. Compte tenue de cela elle veut avoir sa propre maison qu’elle cédera à ses enfants pour les mettre à l’abri du besoin.
texts.en:
Dado, a lady of 47 years of age, is married and mother of two daughters. She has been an active merchant for over 20 years. She embraced her small business very early on, and in that time she most often sold beads and incense. Wanting to benefit from the approaching holidays, Dado decided to renew her loan in order to buy fabrics to resell for the holiday of Tabaski, while also continuing her business of selling incense and beads. She sells her merchandise between 9 am and 1 pm, and between 4 pm and 7 pm. She sells her merchandise on foot and sometimes provides her services for religious ceremonies such as baptisms, weddings...

With the revenue she earns from her business, Dado can diversify the products and services she sells, and pay for breakfast for her children. Dado's children are girls, and in African culture girls are destined for marriage, and for leaving the parental home to join the marital home. With this in mind, Dado wants to have her own home that she can pass on to her children so they will be free from want.

loans.use: to purchase fabric for resale during the holiday of Tabaski.

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr:
Madame Astou une dame de la cinquantaine, s’active dans le commerce depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle est une habituée du guichet car elle est à son 6ème crédit à l’IMCEC. Elle vend tout ce qui est susceptible de générer un bénéfice. Elle veut acheter des chaussures et des tissus et divers autres produits pour vendre lors de la période de la préparation de la fête.
Astou s’occupe du payement des factures d’eau et le reste est géré par son époux. Grace au crédit, elle a pu augmenter son capital et espère pouvoir acheter une autre maison.
texts.en:
Astou, a lady of fifty, has been active as a merchant for more than ten years. She is married and mother. She is a regular at the office as she is on her sixth loan with IMCEC. She sells everything that is likely to generate income. She wants to purchase shoes and fabrics and various other products to sell during the period of preparation for the festival.

Astou handles the payment of water bills and the rest is managed by her husband. Thanks to her loan, she was able to increase her capital and hopes to be able to purchase a different house.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Hezekiah

texts.en:
Hezekiah lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya, which is a popular banana-growing region. He has 3 children and has been doing this work for 10 years. His primary income sources are milk, tea, crops, transportation services and his salary.

He states what is most enjoyable about farming: "Cattle rearing!"  His biggest challenge is "crop farming, especially when attacked by pests and diseases."  Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Nyang'era.'

Hezekiah was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied that he wanted to grow in the area of farming.  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. He said he learned about loan repayment and assets financed.

His highest monthly expenses are family expenses. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, Hezekiah replied that through expansion in farming, their needs will be provided.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Hezekiah owns the following: 'cow, pump, motorcycle' but does not own 'pig, poultry, bicycle, automobile.' Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan.  In the household, this borrower has a mosquito net , TV, and solar power, but does not have 'electricity, running water, sewing machine or a DVD'.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 50 years old and a wholesaler. He is married to Joyce and together they are blessed with four children. Julius has been selling package and storage sacks in wholesale for the past five years. He earns a monthly income of KES 25,000, which he uses to provide for his family. 

Julius is applying for his fourth loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. 

He will use the loan to purchase more sacks for resale. With the expected profit from the business, he will educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: To purchase more package and storage sacks for resale.

loans.name: Kathina

texts.en:
Kathina, is 45 years old and married. She has two children, 17 and 12 years old, whom she supports. 

She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer, and she has a retail shop. She has been in this business for five years, which is located in Malindi.  In her business, she earns a monthly income of KES 9,000. 

She is taking her first loan of KES 30,000, which she intends to use to add stock to her business by buying sugar, milk, rice, maize flour, salt, and oils. 

Kathina will use the anticipated profit to expand her business by making it a wholesale shop. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to grow her business and also to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of sugar, milk, rice, maize flour, and salt to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet 33-year-old Isatu from the eastern Waterloo area in Freetown. She is married with two children, ages 5 and 10. She was a housewife; she began her business because she wants to help her husband to support the home. 

In 2011, Isatu established her clothing business.  She works at the business from 8:00am until 9:00pm, Monday to Friday. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Isatu requires a loan to purchase different types of clothing to expand her clothing business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and buy a piece of land. 

In the future, Isatu plans to own the biggest clothing shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase different types of clothing to expand her clothing business

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie lives in New Kru town which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. Living conditions there are a bit difficult due to the high rate of criminal activity, fewer bathrooms, filthy conditions and overpopulation, but the most interesting part is that rooms are a bit cheaper. There is also the option of traveling; the town contains one of the biggest markets in Liberia,  with lower rates on food.
  
Mamie is married to a local businessman. They have a 19-year-old child who is currently attending school and living at home. Mamie was unfortunate not to attend school, but she started a table market business which sells red oil in the local market. With the loan proceeds, she will buy enough red oil to increase her sales. Her problem is fewer goods on her table. She got money from her husband to establish this business 5 years ago, and she learned by observing other businesswomen. She enjoys the flos of costumers. Her plan is to move from the table business to a shop business.

loans.use: To buy enough red oil to increase her sales.

loans.name: Kargoe

texts.en: Kargoe is 44 years old and lives in the New Kru Area; he is married and has two children ages 6 and 10. His children live at home and attend school. For the past seven years Kargoe has been selling drinks, batteries, rice, toothpaste, and others items in the local market and he enjoys his business because he makes a lot of money. He is requesting a loan to purchase more stock for his business; he plans to educate his children and build a house for them.

loans.use: to purchase more general store items for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of provisions

loans.name: Gbango

texts.en: Gbango lives in Buchanan. She is 48 years old; she did not go to school and is married with seven children between the ages of 17 and  25; only six are in school and live at home. For ten years she has been selling rice, peppers, bitter ball, okra, and palm oil in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her mother and learned it from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, peppers, bitter ball, okra, and palm oil for her business. Her plans are to buy a piece of land and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, peppers, bitter ball (squash), okra, and palm oil for her business

loans.name: Finda

texts.en: Thirty-six-year-old Finda lives in the Airport community, Magibi county, which has the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They have four children aged between three months old and eleven years old. Since 2009 she has been selling rice by the cup in the local market, and she likes how people respond to her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice by the bag for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice by the bag for her business.

loans.name: Siah

texts.en:
Siah is 30 years old. She lives in Margibi County, which is the largest rubber producing area in Liberia. Siah did not have the opportunity to attend school, but she has been involved in business for the past 20 years now; in order to improve her living condition. She is married and has two children, ages 13 and 16, only one of whom lives with her and goes to school. Her husband worked with Firestone. 

Siah started selling rice, soup, cold water and soft drinks with two thousand dollars from her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, oil, pepper, fish, cold water and soft drinks for her business.  She hopes to build a house for herself and children.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, pepper, fish, cold water and soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 32 years old and lives in Compound #3 with her four children between the ages of 10 and 18, who are in school and live at home. For the past nine months, she has been running a table from which she sells rice. A problem she is facing is the complaining of customers about the high price of rice by the cup. She makes a lot of profit and has more customers. She started this business with help from her mother and learned this way of selling from her. She is requesting a loan to buy more rice by the bag for her business. Her plans are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more rice by the bag for her business.

loans.name: Beijing Group

texts.en:
Zena, who is in her early 20s, is married with three kids who are in school. Zena has had a mamalishe (street food) business for three years now. She works from 6:00 am to 5:00 pm daily and is able to earn a good monthly profit. 

This will be her second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loan to buy food cooking supplies like maize and baking flour, beans, rice, sugar and firewood for cooking. She is doing great in her business and managed to pay back her loan successfully. She used her profit to cover household expenses and school fees.  Zena will use this loan to buy more food cooking supplies for her business. She dreams that one day she will be able to own a hotel.

She will share this loan with her loan group " Beijing ",  which includes 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more food cooking supplies

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 56 years old, a mixed crop farmer, and a widow. She is a single mother to two children. Joyce has been farming for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to meet the needs of her family. 

Joyce is applying for her fifth loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. She will use the loan to buy a piece of land for planting different vegetables for sale.

With the anticipated profit from her farm, she will pay school fees for her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land for planting different vegetables for sale

loans.name: Habel

texts.en:
Habel is a 60-year-old married man. He has four children who are 20, 15, 12, and 9 years old respectively, whom he supports. Habel was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer. Habel is a tailor and has been running his tailoring shop for 12 years now. He earns a monthly income of KES 8,000. 

Habel is taking his third loan of KES 35,000, which he intends to use for adding stock to his business by buying clothing materials, zips, canvas, and a sewing machine. He paid back his previous loan of KES 20,000 successfully. Habel will use the anticipated profit to expand his business. His hopes and dreams for his future business and family are to educate his children and to open another tailoring shop.

loans.use: To buy clothing materials, zips, and canvas for sewing and selling to his customers.

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.en:
Shahodat is an entrepreneur who is married and has 3 children. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 6 years. Little by little, with the passing of the time, she has perfected her knowledge.

Thanks to the animal's good condition, she has managed to win a large quantity of customers for her business. She sells her animals in the local market and has many customers.
 
Shahodat is looking for a loan to buy young cattle. In this way she will be able to offer her customers good animals, continue to make financial progress, and provide her household with good earnings. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Idrissa

texts.en:
Meet 29-year-old Idrissa from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. He is married with 2 children age 2 years and 5 years. In 2009, Idrissa established his phone accessories business. He began this business because he wants to create his own permanent source of income, before he was a shopkeeper. He works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Idrissa requires a loan in order to buy phone charger, extension and variety of phone accessories for resale. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to increase his business and renovate his house. In the future; Idrissa plans to import his goods from a neighboring country. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy phone charger, extension and variety of phone accessories for resale.

loans.name: Alie

texts.en:
Meet Alie. He is 33 years old from Waterloo, eastern area in Freetown. He is married with 2 children, ages 2 and 7 years old. For the past 9 years, Alie established his Local food business. He began his business because his parent did not send him to school, so he was trained in business. 

He works at the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., 7 days per week. He says that the main challenges to his business are storage facilities and high cost of transportation.

Alie requires a loan in order to purchase more beans, gari and bags of groundnuts for resale. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him empower himself and increase his business. In the future, Alie plans to build a big house. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more beans, gari, and bags of groundnuts for resale.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen’s food business improved after the first Kiva loan, and he was able to repay the loan without much challenge. 

He wants to improve his other business that he owns, and now seeks a loan to buy beer and soft drinks for his business. The challenges that he faces in the business are competition and prices that are not stable. 

The income that he will raise will improve his standard of living, and he will also be able to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy beer and soft drinks

loans.name: Zaniab

texts.en:
Zaniab, age 46, is a married woman. She is involved in the business of milk sales with her husband. At present, she has one cow and two buffaloes. She has become famous for providing good-quality milk, and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

In order to inflate her sales, she needs to purchase one more cow. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 25,000. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en:
Rasha is a 30-year-old divorced woman who has worked in a sweets-selling shop for four years. She is a hard worker who puts so much effort into developing and improving her living. 

Rasha is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay for necessary medication she needs. Concerning her future plans, Rasha is hoping to open her own coffee shop.

loans.use: to pay for necessary medication she needs

loans.name: Mame Kordia's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé en juillet 2011,il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village,elles ont comme activité le petit commerce et l'agriculture.

Celle qui se trouve à l'extrême droite sur la photo,et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 41 ans,elle est mariée et mére 05 enfants dont 04 garçons.

Elle tient un restaurant où elle vend du petit déjeuner dans son village,elle dispose d'une bonne expérience par rapport à cette activité car elle estime qu'elle a une expérience dans ce domaine riche de plus d'une dizaine d'année.

Elle compte acheter un sac de sucre pour une valeur de 20000f,un bidon d'huile à 15000f,02 kg de café à 2000f le kg et un paquet de lait à 1500f.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne et de participer aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
This group was created in July 2011 and its members all live in the same village. They engage in small scale commerce and farming. 

The woman on the far right of the photo with her hand raised is the leader of the group. She is 41 years old, married, and a mother of five children, of whom four are boys. She runs a restaurant in the village, where she sells breakfast. She has had a good experience with this work, because she estimates that she's been in the business now for more than 20 years.

[With her loan], she plans to buy a sac of sugar worth 20,000 francs, a drum of oil for 15,000 francs, two kilograms of coffee at 2,000 francs each, and some milk for 1,500 francs.

Her goal is to increase her savings and to help with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy sugar, oil, coffee, and milk

loans.name: Marie Augustine's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe a été créé lors de l'inauguration du BV le 19 Mai 2007. Il porte le nom de kadiamor qui signifie en diola entente. Il s'est constitué suite à leur bonne progression dans le BV. Madame Marie Rosine qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants dont quatre garçons et une fille. Avec le prêt elle va acheter des habits, dix paires de chaussures et vingt cinq pièces de tissus teintés. Elle comptabilise une très bonne expérience dans ce domaine. Elle compte vendre à domicile et par système de placement au village. Avec les bénéfices elle va payer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created at the time of the inauguration of the BV [banc villagois] on 19 May 2007. It bears the name of "Kadiamor" which means "agreement" in Diola. The group was formed because of their good progression in the BV.

Marie Rosine, who is on the right of the photo with her hand raised, is the representative of the group. She is married and a mother of five children, four boys and one girl. 

With this loan, she is going to buy clothing, ten pairs of shoes, and 25 pieces of dyed fabric. 

She has had a good experience with this business. 

She plans to sell her goods from home and by the distribution system of the village. 

With the earnings, she is going to pay for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and dyed fabric

loans.name: Karla Amizaday

texts.es: Karla vive  junto a su compañero de vida y su hija en casa propia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 3 años, eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden y al gusto de los clientes; ella es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor y muy luchadora día con día se esfuerza al máximo para ganarse una vida mejor, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Karla tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Karla lives with her life partner and her daughter in her own house.  She has been selling clothes for three years.  This has gifted her with a lot of experience that allows her to get the best earnings.  The business is located at her house.  She has gotten a lot of clientele.  The people know that everything is quality at accessible prices.  She provides unparalleled service, always at the customers’ bidding and to their preferences.

She is an enterprising woman who is devoted to her work.  She is very tenacious.  She puts forth maximum effort day to day in order to earn a better life.  In the past weeks the demand increased.  She wants to take advantage of this in order to make a new investment.

However, she does not have enough money to do so.  That is why she is requesting a loan from Integral.  The loan will allow her to buy clothes for women, men, and children.  Karla has good payment references and an impeccable moral character.  She is sure that she will be able to repay the debt.  She has the hope that she will bring financial security to her household.

loans.use: to buy clothes for women, men, and children.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Don manuel vive en casa propia con su padre y una sobrina, el se dedica a la venta de yinas (sandalias) tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo es de calidad, a precios accesibles. Don Manuel quiere realizar una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital que lo respalde por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar mas yinas (sandalias) de todo estilo,  tallas y colores por mayor para seguir con su negocio, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Manuel lives in his own house with his father and a niece.  He sells sandals, and he has been in the business for several years.  This has gifted him with a lot of experience that allows him to get better earnings.  The business is located at his house.  He has gotten a lot of customers.  The people know that everything is quality at accessible prices.

Manuel wants to make a new investment, but he does not have enough money to do so.  That is why he is requesting a loan that will allow him to buy more sandals.  He will buy all styles, sizes, and colors wholesale in order to continue with his business.

He is sure that he will be able to repay the debt.  He has the hope that he will bring financial security to his household.

loans.use: to buy all styles, sizes, and colors of sandals wholesale.

loans.name: Volonte Divine (1) Group

texts.en: Stany is one of the members of the group Volonte Divine (1). The group consists of four micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. Stany is married with four children, whose ages range from 10 months to 21 years old. Stany is very excited to be receiving his third loan from HOPE Congo after having successfully paid off his previous loans. He has had his business for around seven years. He owns an electronics store, specializing in accessories such as memory cards and flash drives. He says his biggest challenge so far has been controlling theft by employees and customers. Stany has been keeping a log of customer purchases, so he understands what is selling the best in his store. With this next loan he will be buying some of his bestselling items which include CD's, DVD's, memory cards, and flash drives. He hopes in the future to continue to diversify his inventory in order to have a more complete electronic store. With future profits he dreams of one day building a brand new store as well as starting a business for each one of his children. He thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: to pay for CD's, DVD's, memory cards, and flash drives for resale in his store.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is 57 years old and supporting a family of two. He has been in this business for the last 21 years, with a monthly income of ksh 50,000.

He qualified to get a loan from KADET LTD of KES 40,000, with which he plans to purchase building materials for his hotel.

The anticipated profit will be used to expand his hotel business.

His hope and dream is to live financially comfortable.

loans.use: To purchase building materials for his hotel

loans.name: Bintumwa Group

texts.fr:
Anatole fait partie du groupe Bintumwa  et  habite à  Gitega. Il a  33 ans et est mariée  à Concilie, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés  de 1  à  8 ans, dont  2 étudient.

Il fait le commerce de bière  depuis 5 ans. 

Il est à son douzième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de caisses de bière  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, il voudrait acheter des terrains cultivables et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Anatole is part of Bintumwa group and lives in Gitega. He is 33 years old and is married to Concilie a farmer. Together they have four children aged 1 to 8 years, 2 study.

It has made beer for 5 years.

It is his twelfth credit Turame. With credit KIVA it gets, it will increase its capital and buy a lot of cases of beer to sell to earn more.

In the years to come, he would buy arable land and see his children study.

loans.use: il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de caisses de bière  à revendre pour gagner plus.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is from the village of Tkviavi. She is 48 years old and married with a grown son. The family has only seasonal income from agricultural activities. They have a garden where apples and peaches are grown, and a small plot of land for maize growing. The harvests are sold locally.

Liana and her family members live below the poverty line and get a small monthly social assistance from the local government.
 
It’s often difficult for the family to cover feeding costs, that is the reason why Liana decided to purchase a milk cow and start dairy business. Liana will produce cheese for selling as well as family consuming. This loan will be a great support for Liana’s family, as it will generate income.
Liana hopes your kindness

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to produce cheese for selling.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
At the age of 49, Sakina is a married woman and mother of five children. She deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices.

She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf foundation and applied a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase two more goats.

She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 28-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (who is also shown in the photo) at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years.

She is a mother of four children, and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demands at her store. 

She is expecting a boost in her earnings, and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 24-year-old married woman doing a business of selling milk for the past six years. She has 2 calve and 2 dairy cows. She sells the milk to her neighbors. Her business is good enough to lead a decent life. Her husband is a farmer, and he helps her sell out the milk in the neighborhood. 

Khalida has three children; two sons and one daughter. She is motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good food and clothing. She wants to improve her business to meet the day to day expenses of life.

Khalida has requested a loan of RKR 30,000 to purchase one more calve and feed for the animals. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more calve and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Saleema

texts.en:
Saleema is 53 years old and operates an animals sales business. She buys baby goats and calves at low prices, raises them, and sells them in the market at higher prices. She earns enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market.

Saleema is requesting a loan from Kashf Foundation for 25,000 PKR, which she will use to purchase two more goats. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses.  With this loan, she will expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two goats.

loans.name: Nurjan

texts.ru: Нуржан 41 год, разведена одна воспитывает 3 детей. У Нуржан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Нуржан занимается животноводством, стартовав 12 лет назад, с покупки скота на 8,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Нуржан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 16 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 7,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нуржан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Нуржан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Nurjan is 41 years old, divorced and is raising three children on her own. Nurjan has a high school education. As a main source of income for her family, Nurjan is involved in raising livestock, having started 12 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 8,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Nurjan today has on her homestead: 1 dairy cow and 16 sheep. Monthly income consists of 7,500 som (KGS). 

In order to further develop her homestead, Nurjan turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase a cow to increase the livestock count. 

Nurjan plans to invest income from the loan in further increase the quantity of domestic livestock, and plans to save money for home repairs.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Sintiha Jeaqueline

texts.es: Sintiha, tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive en el municipio de Tela junto a su hijo y sus padres. Ella trabajo por varios años en una maquila y al quedar sin empleo decidió por su propio negocio. Hace 1 años que se dedica a la venta de granos básico, verduras, carnes, lácteos, refrescos, dulces, productos de limpieza, achinería, etc. El prestamo que solicita es el tercer ciclo y es por 10,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de más productos para el negocio como harina, refrescos, churros, jabon, huevos, pan, manteca etc. Este prestamo le ha ayudara a diversificar los productos  y obtener mejores ingresos en su negocio. Su meta es termina de estudiar en la universidad y hacer crecer el  el negocio hasta convertirla en una bodega.
texts.en:
Sintiha is 29 years old and a single mother. She lives with her children and parents in the municipality of Tela. When she lost her job at an assembly plant where she had worked for several years, Sintiha decided to start her own business. For one year she has been selling basic grains, vegetables, meat, dairy products, soft drinks, candy, cleaning products, novelties, and other items.

Sintiha is requesting her third loan from the field partner for 10,000 HNL to buy more products for her business such as flour, soft drinks, chips, ham, eggs, bread, lard and other groceries. She says that this loan will allow her to increase the variety of products she sells, which will make her business more profitable. Sintiha says that her goal is to finish university and expand her business into a full-fledged grocery store.

loans.use: to buy flour, soft drinks, chips, ham, eggs, bread, lard and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Protais

texts.en:
Protais is a 34-year-old man from the Muhanga district in the southern province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of Sixty Thousand Rwandan Francs (RWF 60,000) to purchase 20 rechargeable LED lights, which he will sell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100.  

He is also a carpenter, and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business.

loans.use: To pay for 20 low-cost LED lights to sell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Narantsetseg, 30 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She began running a automobile repair workshop three months ago by renting a garage near the automobile market. Before this, she and her husband had run a cafeteria. 

Narantsetseg is requesting a loan of 2500000 MNT to purchase spare parts from her supplier in large amounts at a relatively lower price. By doing so, she can run her business without worrying about spare parts shortage.

loans.use: buy auto spare parts

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 49-year-old married mother of five children. She has been working as a tailor for fifteen years. In 2010, she started her own business which she runs from her house. She is a hard worker who puts much effort into helping her husband in improving their family’s living and  covering their expenses.

Mariam is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a new updated tailoring machine to produce better quality in a shorter time.

Concerning the future, Mariam is hoping to open a clothes factory which will improve her family’s socio-economic situation.

loans.use: to buy a new updated tailoring machine to produce better quality in a shorter time.

loans.name: Sante Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    SANTE est constitué de 6 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO CENTRE de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 3éme prêt. Les 2 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  bois de chauffe à l’image de OUMOU qui est la 3éme femme assise  dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 1 chargement de camion(de 10 tonnes)en bois de chauffe auprès des villageois. Elle effectue ses ventes à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The SANTE group is made up of six married women who, on average, are 29 years old and have three children each. They live as traditional families in the 
Central Heremakono district of the city of Bougouni. They met each other through being neighbours, friends and by doing business together. In order to reinforce their financial capacity and improve their business, they became members of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are now working with their third loan. The two previous loans were paid back in full. This group of women are in the firewood trade, just like Oumou, the third woman from the left who is sitting down in the photo. With this loan, she will purchase 1 truckload (10 tons) of firewood with the villagers. She sells wood from her home, working with cash and credit, to both male and female customers. She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA, which will be invested into the business and used to pay off the loan.

loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.ru: Дилфуза 39-летняя замужняя женщина. Она живет с мужем и детьми в городе Курган-Тюбе. Дилфуза собирается начать торговый бизнес. Она хочет заняться купле-продажей кухонной и столовой посуды. Дилфуза уже приобрела прилавку на местном рынке. Ее стартовый капитал составляет 400 долларов США. Однако этой суммы недостаточно, чтобы приобрести товар и поэтому она обратилась за кредитом. На сумму от кредита и сбережения она хочет закупить ассортимент кухонной и столовой посуды. Она наконец то решила заняться любимым делом. Дилфузе всегда нравилось сервировка стола и кухни. Теперь она сможет сама выбрать посуды для продажи и помогать хозяйкам с выбором. Дилфуза уже верит в успех своего нового бизнеса и ждет вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Dilfuza is 39 years old, is married, and lives with her husband and children in Qurgan-Tube. Dilfuza would like to start a business buying and selling kitchen and tableware. She already has a stand at the local market, and her starting capital is $400 USD. However, this amount is not enough to buy her goods; therefore, she is requesting a loan. The amount of the loan and her savings will be used to buy an assortment of kitchen and tableware. 

Dilfuza has at last decided to do what she loves; she has always enjoyed setting the table and organizing the kitchen. Now, Dilfuza will be able to choose dishes to sell and to help customers in their selection. Dilfuza is already confident in the future success of her business and is thankful for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy kitchenware and start her business.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro, de 51 años vive con Ceferina, su pareja y madre de sus hijos. Ahora solo vive con el menor de todos. Ellos habitan en la casa propia que construyeron con esfuerzo, ubicada en un anexo agrícola. Pedro es un hombre responsable y trabajador. Desde joven le gustó el trabajo en el campo, por eso hasta ahora se dedica a las labores agrícolas. “Siembro papas, maíz, arvejas, habas, flores de gladiolos, y otros; crece de todo aquí”, menciona orgulloso. En sus más de 25 años de trabajo ha conseguido muchas satisfacciones y frustraciones, pero afirma que todas esas experiencias lo ayudan en su crecimiento como emprendedor. Dice que la siembra de todos sus productos son rentables, solo depende de cultivarlos en meses específicos para cosecharlos cuando los precios sean buenos. Ahora cuenta con terrenos propios que poco a poco iba pagando, ya que antes tenía que arrendarlos. En sus planes próximos están el cultivar arvejas y maíz, por eso solicita de su apoyo.
Este es su quinto préstamo con KIVA, y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Pedro, invertirá los S/.3800 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus cultivos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Pedro is 51 years old and lives with Ceferina, his partner and mother of his children. Only the youngest of them still lives with them. They live in their own house, located in an agricultural enclosure, which they built with their effort. Pedro is a responsible and hard-working man. Since he was young he has enjoyed work in the fields, so he has worked in agriculture until now. "I grow potatoes, corn, peas, broad beans, gladiolas and others: we grow everything here" he says proudly. In more than 25 years of work, he has gotten much satisfaction and felt frustrations, but he affirms that all these experiences have help him grow as an entrepreneur. He says that all his produce is profitable, it depends on planting them in certain months when the prices will be good. He now has his own land which he is paying off little by little. Before he worked on rented land.

In his short term plan Pedro wants to plant peas and corn and he is requesting a loan to help him do this. This is his fifth loan with Kiva and he is grateful for the support that allows him to get ahead. He promises to pay his installments on time. Pedro will invest the 3,800 PEN to buy organic fertilizer to nurture his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: N’To

texts.fr:
N’TO est âgé de 45 ans et vit avec ses sept enfants et ses époux à DIENFING dans la sous préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU, Région de KOULIKORO.
N’TO   n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage vente de céréales. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut  commerçant de céréales. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement           remboursé le six prêts précédents, il est à son septième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter,  4 tonnes de céréales et produits agricoles composé de : maïs, haricot, mil et fonio auprès des paysans producteurs de DIENFING et environnants qu’il gardera pendant au moins 3 mois. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako, OUELESSEBOUGOU.
N’TO  espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
N’TO is 45 years old and lives with his seven children and spouses in Dienfing, which is located in the Ouelessebougou sub-prefecture, Koulikoro region.

N’TO did not go to school. Very early on, he became in interested in revenue generating activities - namely buying, stocking, and selling cereals. He learned this business from an uncle on his mother's side who was a cereal merchant.
 
With the hope of satisfying his client base, which is clearly growing, he decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso. After having properly repaid his six previous loans, this is his seventh individual loan, which will help him buy four tons of cereal and agricultural products such as: corn, beans, millet, and fonio (a West African grain). He buys his supplies from the peasant farmers in and around Dienfing, and he will keep these supplies for at least 3 months. 

He sells mostly at wholesale prices to clients who are resellers from large cities like Bamako and Ouelessebougou. N’TO hopes to earn an average monthly income of 100,000 FCFA, which he’ll use to reimburse the loan and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals and agricultural products.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Женщина, которая является хранительницей очага своего дома и опорой для своих детей, имеет грандиозную идею, организовать новый бизнес. Зулфия много лет не имела источника дохода. Так как ее муж имеет маленькую зарплату и не в состоянии обеспечить своих 5 детей со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Дети год за годом требуют больше благ, так как они развеваются вместе с развевающимся миром. Она решила организовать бизнес купле продажей промышленных товаров. Она долго искала помощь и наконец, она узнала о курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованной Ассоциация Деловых Женщин. Она участвовала на этом курсе и получила много позитива для себя. После завершения курса она получила сертификат. Теперь она готова начать бизнес, однако она не имеет денег, чтобы купить товар. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов для покупки товара. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
A woman who is the keeper of the hearth at her home and the supporter of her children has a grand idea for organizing a new business. For many years, Zulfiya has had no source of income. Since her husband has a small salary and is not able to provide their five children with all the necessary means. Year after year, the children need more support since they are growing up in a developing world.

She decided to start a business trading industrial goods. She has been look for help for a long time and finally she heard about the course "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women. She participated in this course and received a lot of positivity about herself. After completing the course, she received a certificate. Now, she is read to start a business, but she does not have money to purchase goods. 

She is requesting a loan of US$3,000 to buy goods.

loans.use: to buy industrial goods for organizing a new business

loans.name: Dúo Mercadito Group

texts.es:
Dúo Mercadito 
 La señora julia Leonor ella es propietaria de una venta de ropa americana(segunda mano o paca) que en nuestro vocabulario chapín le llamamos paca, tiene aproximadamente 6 años de tener su venta, mensualmente ella hace las compra de dos lotes de ropa los cuales tiene que sacar la ropa clasificada y los saldos que en su mayoría son ganancia para ella….doña julia en 3 o 4 días saca el capital invertido para el mismo y que durante los otros 11 días siguientes son para sacar sus ganancias ella aparte de tener la venta de ropa también tiene uno de zapato el cual tiene una empleada que le ayuda allí mismo en su local para poder darse abasto con las personas y llevar un mejor control financiero, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia(ropa) y asi aumentar un pococ mas sus ventas.
texts.en:
Dúo Mercadito 

Julia Leonor has a business selling American clothes (secondhand).  Guatemalans call it ‘paca’ [pack or bundle].  She has been selling for approximately six years.  She buys two lots of clothes a month.  She needs to organize the clothes and the remnants, which are mostly earnings for her.

In three or four days Julia gets out the money invested in the business.  During the following 11 days she gets her profits.  Aside from having the clothing sales, she also has a shoe business.  She has one employee who helps her at her place.  She does this in order to be able to cope with the people and to have better financial control.

She is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise (clothes).  This way she will increase her sales a little more.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo en casa propia, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, sus productos las comercializa en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; él  necesita invertir por eso le solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, insecticida, herbicida, abonos, fertilizantes, etc. el cliente  tiene buenas referencias de parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
This client lives with his life partner and their son in a house he owns.  He works growing corn and beans and has been working in agriculture for several years gaining much experience which leads to better harvests.  He sells his products around the community and has a large clientele that prefers him for the quality, good prices and above all good service.  

He needs to invest which is why he’s requesting a loan that will make it possible for him to buy seeds, insecticide, manure, fertilizer, etc.  He has good references from his acquaintances and he’s very responsible.  He’s sure that he will be able to repay the loan in the established time period while at the same time is confident that he’ll provide his home with economic security.

loans.use: to buy seed and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es: Francisco es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa, él es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultor siembra todos los años los principales granos básicos de la zona como lo son, maíz y frijol, adicional a eso cultiva plátano y yuca. Francisco desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas, controles de plagas, entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Francisco’s is very committed to his responsibilities at home and has always been noted for providing the best for his family.  He currently lives with his wife.  He’s very hardworking and has always worked with joy and enthusiasm.  Every year he grows the main local basic grains: corn and beans.  In addition he also grows bananas and cassava.  

He wants to increase his sales which is why he visited the INTEGRAL offices to request a loan that will make it possible for him to buy manure, fertilizer, pesticide, pest control, etc.  He’d like to have the requested support because he has no other source of income.  He will thus continue providing daily bread for his home with no limitations whatsoever.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Ivan Leonel

texts.es: Ivan es una persona muy amable y trabajador, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos de 15, 13 y 7 años de edad, él trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maíz y frijol; sus productos son de muy buena calidad comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia adicional a eso se dedica a la crianza de ganado de pasto. Ivan solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas y la compra de vitaminas para el ganado, entre otras cosas que necesita, él ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Iván’s a very kind, hardworking man living with his wife and three children who are 15, 13 and 7 years old.  He works very hard on his own land growing corn and beans.  His products are very good quality and he sells them in various markets near his place of residence.  In addition to this, he also raises cattle.

Iván’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to have money needed to invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies like pest control, fertilizer, manure, seeds and vitamins for the cattle, among other things he needs.  He hopes to increase his sales to earn higher profits and give his family better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José de 49 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra frijol y maíz,  con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador vive con su esposa y su hija de 12 años de edad. Jose  está solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, controles de plagas, etc. asi como muestra la fotografía, ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
José, 49, has worked in agriculture growing corn and beans for several years now.  He covers some of his household expenses with profits from selling his crops.  He’s a responsible, honest, hardworking man living with his wife and 12-year-old daughter.

José is asking for a loan to be able to buy supplies like fertilizer, manure, seed, herbicide, pest control, etc. for his crops as shown in the photo since what he earns is insufficient to cover these expenses and thus he will earn higher income and have better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la clienta vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella  posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda mas surtida, las personas la prefieren y la mantienen delante de la competencia porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, como toda buena comerciante  quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. la clienta asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This client lives in her own house with her life companion and their son.  She has a store where she sells basic staples like beans, milk, eggs and bread, among others.  She’s been in business many years and has gained much sales experience that makes it possible for her to earn higher profits.  The store is located at home in a very busy location.  

She’s acquired a large clientele because her store is well-stocked.  People prefer her and keep her ahead of the competition because she always has what they need in stock: good quality products at affordable prices with unequaled service always.  

Like all good merchants, she wants to increase business and make a new investment but needs capital to do so which is why she’s asked INTEGRAL for a loan to buy basic grains, snacks, eggs, bread, beverages, etc.  She’s sure that she’ll repay the loan while at the same time is confident that she’ll provide her family with better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente tiene un negocio de venta de tortas y hamburguesas desde hace 2 años tiene muy buena clientela pues vende su comida a un buen precio,  su negocio lo tiene ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene solventa algunos gastos que hay su casa, vive con su compañera de vida y su hija de un mes de nacida en casa propia, el cliente solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario para elaborar sus tortas y hamburguesas como: pan, tomates, cebollas, mayonesa, mortadelas, entre otros ingredientes y así poder tener mejores ganancias y una mejor calidad de vida con su esposa y su hija.
texts.en:
The client has had a business selling sandwiches and hamburgers for the past two years. He has a good clientele as he sells his food at a good price. His business is located close to his residence. He hopes to pay off some of the household expenses he has. He lives with his life partner and a month old daughter in their own home. 

The client is requesting a loan to buy everything he needs to make his sandwiches and hamburgers like: bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, mortadela sausage and other ingredients. He hopes to generate more revenue and have a better quality of living with his wife and child.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, and mortadela sausage, etc.

loans.name: Tereza De Los Dolores

texts.es: Teresa de 42 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 5 años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maíz y el  frijol, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas solventa algunos de los gastos que su familia tiene, es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos de 17 y 11 años de edad, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comparar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc.  y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir dando a sus hijos lo que necesitan sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en:
Teresa is 42 years old, and during the last 5 years working in agriculture she has gained the competences and knowledge necessary to handle her crops; she grows primarily corn and beans. Teresa sells her crops near her home, at establishments that sell and buy bulk grains. She is able to cover some of the family expenses with the income from her sales. Teresa is a single mother of two sons who are 11 and 17 years old, and she is a homeowner. 

She is requesting this loan to buy agricultural inputs to supplement the farming of her crops: compost, seeds, fertilizers, pest control, etc. and in this way, increase her revenue, and continue to provide and give to her children what they need without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy compost, seeds, fertilizers, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la clienta vive junto a su compañero de vida quien es empleado de una fabrica y dos hijos, ella es una mujer muy responsable quien siempre está en miras de mejorar su estabilidad económica. Ella trabaja en su propia panadería en la que elabora pan francés, quesadillas y pan dulce, el cual elabora ella sola a primeras horas de la madrugada para poder venderlo antes del desayuno, que es cuando las personas más lo consumen al igual que en la cena. Ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para contar con la ayuda necesaria para invertir en la compra de harina, levadura, manteca, latas y todo lo necesario para poder producir más. Este proyecto de mejoramiento para su panadería es muy importante para ella puesto que así mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
The client lives together with her life partner, who is an employee in a factory and their two children. She is a very responsible woman who is always on the look-out to ways to stabilize her financial situation. She works in her own bakery where she makes French bread, quesadillas and pastries. She works in the hours before dawn in order to sell them before breakfast. This is when her clients consume them as well as at dinnertime. 

The client is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, in order to have the help she needs to buy: flour, yeast, lard, metal baking pans and everything she needs to be able to produce more. These improvements to her bakery are important to her as this is how she plans to improve the quality of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, lard and metal baking pans.

loans.name: Sarvinoz

texts.ru: Сарвиноз молодая и жизнерадостная девушка. Ей 26 лет. Она замужем и имеет 2 детей. Детям Тухфе 6 лет и Фарахнозу 3 года. Она по специальности преподаватель. Она данное время не работает по специальности. Она занимается купле продажей сухофруктов. Она более 7 лет занимается этим бизнесом. Сарвиноз в этом году поступила в университет, чтобы получить экономическое образование. Она учится в факультете Финансы и кредит. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Sarvinoz is a cheerful, young woman. She is 26 years old. She is married and has two children. The children are Tukhfe and Farakhnozy are 6 and 3 years old, respectively. By profession, she is a teacher. She is not currently working in her specialty. She is involved in trading dried fruits. For more than seven years she has been involved in this business. 

This year, Sarvinoz enrolled in a university in order to receive an economics education. She is studying in the faculty of finance and credit. She needs to pay her tuition and she is requesting a loan to do so.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.ru: Мукаддас вместе с мужем и 3 детьми живет далеко от города в сельской местности и занимается скотоводством. Перед тем как она начала свой бизнес , ей было очень тяжело справляться с семейными расходами. Ее муж мало зарабатывал и его доход не хватал для содержания семьи. Она была вынуждена начать бизнес и зарабатывать на жизнь, так как обеспечение 3 детей требовала больше благ. Итак, 9 лет назад она начала свой бизнес скотоводством. Мукаддас данное время имеет 21 баранов. Она хорошо справляется с бизнесом. Ее муж помогает ей по введению бизнеса. Мукаддас запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки корма для скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mukaddas lives with her husband and three children far from the city in a rural area and is engaged in raising livestock. Before starting her own business, it was very hard for her to manage the family expenses. Her husband earned a little and his income was not enough to support a family. She was forced to start a business and earn a living since providing for three children demanded more support. And so, nine years ago she began her livestock business Mukaddas currently has 21 sheep. She handles the business well. Her husband helps her in running the business. 

Mukaddas is requesting a loan of 1,500 somoni to purchase livestock feed.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора молодая и трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 28 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Детям 3 и 1 года. Она еще в родительском доме научилась шитью женской одежды. Ее ремесло очень помогло ей в жизни. Ее муж не зарабатывает достаточно денег, чтобы обеспечить семью со всеми необходимыми средствами. Гулнора более 9 лет занимается предоставлением услуги швеи. Она предоставляет свои услуги на высшем уровне и старается привлечь больше клиентов. Гулнора является повторной клиенткой ИМОН. Другие займы она использовала для развития своего бизнеса, то есть она купила швейную машинку марки «Чайка». Она запрашивает этот займ для покупки новой машинки оверлок. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Gulnora is a young hard-working woman. She is 28 years old. She is married and raising two children. Her husband is a work migrant in the Russian Federation. Her children are three and one year old. While still at her parents’ home, she learned how to sew women’s clothing. This trade has helped her a lot in life. Her husband does not make sufficient money to provide the family with all necessities. For over nine years, Gulnora has been working as a seamstress. She provides high-level service and tries to attract new customers. Gulnora has been a client of IMON in the past. She used her prior loans to expand her business, i.e. she bought a new sewing machine of the Chaika brand. She is requesting this loan in order to buy a new overlock sewing machine. She is counting on your kindness and hopes for your compassion.

loans.use: to buy a new overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Kumrijon

texts.ru: Кумричон живет в деревни. Ее деревня находится далеко от города. Она 3 года назад начала свой бизнес, не так как другие жители земледелием и скотоводством, а купле продажей продуктов питания. Так как она живет в сельской местности и там мало конкуренции, так и ей легко справляться с бизнесом. Она покупает товар оптом из городского рынка и реализует в розницу на своей лавке. Она общительная и милая женщина и поэтому умеет делать индивидуальный подход каждому клиенту. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и получать больше дохода. Для этого ей необходимо увеличить оборотный капитал. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки продуктов питания как хлеб, молочные продукты, мясные продукты и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
