Kumrijon lives in a village. Her village is far from the city. Three years ago, she began her own business, not in farming or livestock like other people but in trading food products. Since she lives in a rural area and there is little competition, it is easy for her to cope with the business. She purchases goods wholesale from the city market and sells them at retail prices at her shop. She is a sociable and kind woman and therefore she succeeds in making an individual approach to each customer. 

She wants to expand her business and receive more income. For this purpose, she needs to increase her working capital. She is requesting a loan of 1,500 somoni to purchase food products such as bread, dairy products, meat products, and the like.

loans.use: to buy food items for her food store

loans.name: Onaoy

texts.ru: Онаой родилась в 1953 года. Она вдова. После смерти мужа она сама воспитывала своих детей. Она сталкивалась многими трудностями, но благодаря упорному труду она смогла поставить себя на ноги и беречь детей от голода и холода. Она уже много лет работает в детском садике. Онаой является опытным воспитателем. Она любит детей и ей комфортно заниматься воспитанием детей. Онаой хочет, чтобы все ее дети получили высшее образование. Ее сын учится в университете и ей необходимо оплатить за обучение сына. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Onaoy was born in 1953. She is widowed, and after her husband's death she raised her children on her own. She faced many challenges, but thanks to her persistent hard work she was able to get on her feet and keep her children from hunger and cold. Onaoy has been working in a kindergarten for many years, and is an experienced teacher. She loves children and is comfortable working with them. 

Onaoy would like her children to receive higher education. Her son is studying at a university and she must pay for it. She is requesting a loan of 5000 somoni in order to pay for the registration. She is thankful for your kindness and graciousness.

loans.use: To pay for education

loans.name: Zulola

texts.ru: Зулола молодая и порядочная девушка. Ей 20 лет. Она занимается собственным бизнесом. Зулола предоставляет услуги швеи. Несмотря на молодость, она несет большую ответственность, то есть она занимается воспитанием своих братьев, так как ее родители трудовые мигранты в Российской Федерации. Зулола заработанные деньги использует для покупки продуктов питания и одежды для себя и своих братьев. Она добрая и великодушная девушка. Зулола скоро выходит замуж. Однако она не имеет денег, чтобы организовать свадебное торжество. Ее родители не отправили ей денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Zulola is a decent young woman. She is 20 years old and has her own business offering sewing services. Despite her youth, she holds a lot of responsibility for raising her brothers, since her parents are migrant workers in the Russian Federation. Zulola spends her income on food and clothing for herself and her brothers. She is a kind and generous woman.

Zulola is getting married soon. However, she does not have enough money to organize a wedding reception; her parents have not sent her money. She is requesting a loan of 6000 somoni in order to organize a wedding celebration. She is thankful for your kindness.

loans.use: To hold her wedding celebration

loans.name: Jonibek

texts.ru: Джонибек родился в 1993 года. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Джонибек является успешным студентом Таджикского Государственного Университета Коммерции. Он учится по специальности Налоговое дело. Джонибек учится успешно. Он часто посещает библиотеку и читает много книг. Джонибек мечтает после окончания университета работать в государственном учреждении и служить своей Родине. Его родители гордятся им. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Jonibek was born in 1993. He is unmarried and lives with his parents. Jonibek is a successful student at the Tajik State University of Commerce, and is studying tax law. Jonibek frequently visits the library and reads many books. He dreams of working at a government institution and serving his country after graduation. His parents are proud of him. Jonibek is requesting the loan in order to pay for his educational agreement. He is thankful for your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for education

loans.name: Nasibakhon

texts.ru: Дом, где живет Насибахон, не отвечает стандартам жилья и она срочно должна отремонтировать свой дом. Ей 41 года, она вдова и на воспитании имеет одну дочь. Ее дочь учится в средней школе, и всегда просит мать отремонтировать их дом, но ее зарплата не достаточно для этого. Она имеет средне - специальное образование бухгалтера. Насибахон более 6 лет работает в организации бухгалтером. Полученную зарплату она использует для содержания дочери. Насибахон старается, чтобы ее дочь не почувствовала, что она сирота. Она уже несколько лет планирует отремонтировать свой старый и маленький дом, так как в последнее время жить в таком доме стало невозможным. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nasibakhon's home is not fit for habitation and needs urgent renovations. Nasibakhon is 41 years old, widowed, and is raising a daughter. Her daughter is in high school, and is always asking her mother to repair the house, but Nasibakhon's income is not enough to cover it. Nasibakhon has vocational training as a bookkeeper, and uses her income to provide for her daughter. Nasibakhon tries to prevent her daughter from feeling like an orphan. For the past few years, she has been planning to make repairs to the old, small house, since living there has become impossible. She is requesting a loan of 5000 somoni to buy building materials such as cement, wood, etc. She is thankful for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement and wood to repair her house

loans.name: Sona

texts.en:
Sona is 45 years old and she lives with her son in Vanadzor city. Sona is a widow and during many years she has done her best in order to bring up a clever and honest person. 

Sona has graduated from Vanadzor Commercial College, Department of Accounting. Now she works at the city municipality as an accountant. Her son is a worker in a workshop. 

Sona and her son recently managed to do some repair work on their cute flat, but they still have some problems connected with the heating system of their flat.

Sona asks a loan of AMD 700,000 (Armenian drams) in order to buy a heating system, to be ready for the coming cold, winter months.

loans.use: to buy a heating system, to be ready for the coming cold, winter months.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 33 years old, female, and married. She has three children, ages 17, 14, and 10; she supports them all. 

She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer, and she has a retail shop.  She has been in this business for 12 years, and it is located in Mrereni. She earns a monthly income of ksh.6,000 from her business. 

She is taking her first loan of ksh 20,000, which she intends use by adding stock to her business, such as sugar, rice, maize flour, salts, and fats.

Margaret will use the anticipated profit to expand her business by making it into a wholesale shop. 

Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to grow her business, and also to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more stock, like sugar, maize flour, rice, salts, and fats to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Haguruka Group

texts.fr:
Violette fait partie du groupe Haguruka et habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 36 ans et est mariée à Pierre, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 1 à 14 ans, dont  3 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de boutique (riz, haricot, légume vert,…) depuis 10 ans. 

Elle est à son cinquième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de riz,de haricot, de légume vert,…  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, elle voudrait construire sa propre maison et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Violette is a member of the Haguruka group and she lives in Bujumbura. She is 36 years old and is married to Pierre, a storekeeper. They have five children together between the ages of 1 and 14, three of whom currently receive an education.

She has been working in a store (selling rice, beans, green vegetables, etc...) for 10 years.

This will be her fifth loan with Turame. Upon receiving this Kiva loan, this will increase her capital and allow her to buy large quantities of rice,  beans and green vegetables which she will re-sell for profit.

In the coming years, she would like to build her own house and see her children receive an education.

loans.use: elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz,de haricot, de légume vert,…  à revendre pour gagner plus.

loans.name: Gloria Group

texts.fr: La cliente Dina est membre d’une association de crédit « Gloria ». La cliente est une femme célibataire, âgée de 35 ans et mère de 7 enfants qui étudient. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 5 sacs de farine de maïs et de manioc pour accroitre son activité. Elle commença  son commerce,  avec son fonds propre reçu de son petit ami.Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite scolariser, nourrir et vêtir ses enfants.  Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux petits entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: Dina is a storekeeper and a member of the Gloria association. She is a 35-year-old single mother of seven children, four of which are receiving an education, while the other three are still children. She sells foodstuffs. She has requested a loan from Hekima. She wants to buy two sacks of flour and maize and three sacks of cassava flour in order to grow her business. She had started this business out of her own savings with money received from her ex-boyfriend. In the future, she wishes to send her children to school, as well as feed and clothe them. She would like to thank Hekima for the support it gives small enterprises excluded from the classic banking system. She would also like to point out that certain customers carry their babies with them.

loans.use: 5 sacs de farine de maïs et de manioc

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Muze Ii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Muze II  comporte 4 hommes et une femme. Sur la photo, Stany est représenté par sa femme Jacquelline.

Annociate fait partie du groupe  MUZE II et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a  32 ans et est mariée  à Déogratias, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés  de 1  à  8 ans, dont  2 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de matériaux de construction (ciment, fer à béton, clous,…) depuis 6 ans. 

Elle est à son cinquième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  20 sacs de ciment, des fer à béton, 200kg de clous  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, elle voudrait acheter une voiture et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
The group Muze Ii is made up of four men and one woman.  In the photo, Stany is represented by his wife Jacquelline.  Annocaite is part of this group and lives in Bujumbura.  She is 32 years old and is married to Déogratias, a merchant.  Together they have 3 children between 1 and 8 years old, but only two are students.  She has been trading in building materials (cement, reinforced concrete, nails, etc) for 6 years.  

This will be Annociate's fifth loan with the field partner Turame.  With this KIVA loan, she will increase her capital and buy 20 sacks of cement, reinforced concrete and 200kg of nails for resale to earn more.  In the coming years, Annociate would like to buy a car and see her children study.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy 20 sacks of cement, reinforced concrete and 200kg of nails for resale.

loans.name: Ermon

texts.en: Ermon is a 50-year-old woman. She lives with her daughter and granddaughter in Akhalkalaki district. Ermon works at a local cafe as an administrator and gets 500 GEL per month. Her daughter is currently unemployed. As the existing income is not enough for a 3-member family, Ermon decided to start her own business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $650 and start trading clothing. She will purchase clothing from the wholesalers and then sell among her coworkers and neighbors. This will increase the income of her family.

loans.use: to begin trading clothing

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine is from Yerevan. She has been earning her living by providing manicure services to local ladies in Yerevan. Due to her good work she has gained many loyal customers. Unfortunately her living conditions are not appropriate for receiving her clients at her house. She is asking for this loan to purchase furniture for her work room and also manicure accessories which she needs for her work.

Armine has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This loan is very important for Armine and she hopes for the lenders' generosity.

loans.use: to pay for manicure accessories and purchase furniture for her work room.

loans.name: Borik

texts.en:
Borik is from Goris city of Syuniq region. He lives with his pensioner mother and his father. Borik works in the military service. He and his family are engaged in beekeeping; they have 40 beehives. Borik realizes the honey in the local market. Beekeeping in an important source of income for the family.

He currently needs a loan of USD 2,500 to purchase some more beehives and special medications for beekeeping. He has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to return it back. However, thanks to the hard work during the recent times, Borik was able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

So, he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Borik and his family will be grateful to all the lenders for helping them maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase more beehives and special medications for beekeeping.

loans.name: Koryun

texts.en:
Koryun is from the village of Vahagni in Lori region. He lives with his mother, wife, and little son and daughter (8 and 6 years old). To be able to cover the needs of the family, Koryun is engaged in breeding a livestock of cows, pigs, piglets and hens. Koryun realizes the agricultural products in the local market. 

To run his agribusiness in a more effective way, he needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase tractor and start land cultivation. He has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to return it back. However, thanks to the hard work during the recent times, Koryun was able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

So, he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Koryun and his family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase tractor for starting cultivation of the land

loans.name: Keto

texts.en:
Keto, age 52, is from the old and historical town of Telavi, Georgia. She is widowed, and lives with her grown daughter, Maka. Maka works as a cashier-operator at the local commercial bank, and gets a small salary (approximately $120 per month). Keto has also a son, who lives and works in Austria and helps his family financially.

As the majority of middle-aged Georgian women, Keto stays home and takes care of her house. She is an excellent mother and tries to give her children all the best. Keto sorrows that she is not able to generate income for the family; that is why she had decided to start her own business and go to Turkey to purchase apparel and linens to sell. Prices are lower in Turkey than in Georgia, and as there are not many clothing stores in Telavi, her service will have high demand. Keto used to work as a saleslady at the clothing store and has the appropriate experience in this field. 

At first, she will sell the items from her house to her community members. There are also two villages near Telavi, and Keto and her daughter plan to sell products there as well. 

The profit will be reinvested in the same business, and Keto will be able to rent a commercial space in her town and set up a store to increase the sales volume.

Keto believes in your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of clothing and linens to start a trading business

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en: Samvel is from Kapan city in the Syuniq region and lives with his elderly pensioner parents. He works as a clerk in the government sector. However, his salary is not enough to take care of his family's needs. He is breeding cattle and realizes the agricultural products in the local market. To be able to meet his and his pensioner parents' everyday needs, Samvel needs to enlarge the amount of cattle a little bit. He needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase two cows and a calf. It will help him a lot in maintaining his agribusiness and improving the life conditions of his family. Samvel and his family will be very thankful to all the lenders for helping them gather the amount of loan needed and to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase two cows and a calf

loans.name: Ayad

texts.en:
Ayad is a hard-working carpenter from Iraq; he is 33 years old, married, and has a child. 

Ayad specializes in making furniture and doors. He has been in this field since 1998, and has mastered what he practices. Now, Ayad has an employee hired, is well known in the surrounding area, and has earned an excellent reputation.

Ayad is requesting a loan of 1,500 USD, which he will use to buy a special piece of equipment used for cutting wood; he will also increase his raw materials. 

He is aiming to grow his business, and improve the variety of his productions so that he may gain more customers and enhance his current financial condition.

loans.use: to buy a specialized machine used to cut wood, and to increase his raw materials

loans.name: Toktokan

texts.ru: Токтокан 42 года, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает пятерых детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Токтокан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Токтокан занимается садоводством и полеводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Токтокан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Токтокан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян абрикоса, яблони, персика и сливы, в дальнейшем выращивает их как саженцы, часть саженцев продает, часть оставляет и когда эти саженцы приносят плоды, продают плоды этих деревьев. Доходы от кредита Токтокан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Toktokan is a 42-year-old widow. After the death of her husband, she is raising five children on her own, and also running their farm. Toktokan has a high school education. As a main source of income for her family, Toktokan  занимается садоводством и полеводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, 1,000 сом KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Toktokan today has on her farm: 4 dairy cows. Monthly income consists of 10,000 som (KGS). 

In order to further develop her farm, Toktokan turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to buy seeds for apricots, apples, peaches, and plums to be grown into seedlings. Some of them will be sold as seedlings; and the rest will be kept so that, when they are bearing fruit, the fruit will be sold.

Toktokan plans to invest income from the loan in further increasing the count of domestic animals.

loans.use: to buy apricot, peach and plum seeds

loans.name: Leman

texts.en:
Leman  had  been  able  to  provide  for  a  comfortable  life  managing  her  own  cafe  until  she  lost her  house  and  then  job  after  acting  as  a  guarantor  for  her  husband's  friend. Because  she  moved to  a  new  city  and  her  marriage  ended, she  was  forced  to  start  her  life  over  again  and  was unable  to  get  support  from  her  son. Now  she  is  managing  her  own  life,  taking  care  of  a  sick woman  and  also  working  with  trousseau  items. She  sells the  trousseau  pieces  she  makes  by  hand  at  her  friend's  store  and  with  the  loan  she  will  get,  she  wants  to  buy  wholesale  and  provide more  types  of  products. Her  goal  is  to  open  a  store  and  be  able  to  sell  trousseau  items  to more  people. Despite  all  the  problems  she  has  experienced,  she  has  never  lost  hope,  always  keeps smiling  and  never  gives  up. 

Translated  from  Turkish  by  Maya  Staff

Leman  Hanım ,  kendisine  ait  kafeyi  işletip  rahat  sayılabilecek  bir  hayat  yaşarken  eşinin arkadaşına  kefil  olması  nedeniyle  önce  evini  sonra  işini  kaybetmiş.Yaşadığı  şehri  değiştirmek , eviliğinin  de  bitmesi  nedeniyle  kendi  hayatını  en  baştan  kurmak  zorunda  kalmış  ve  bu  dönemde oğlundan  da  destek  alamamış.Şu  an  tek  başına  hayat  mücadelesi  veriyor,  hasta  bir  kadına  bakıcılık  yaparken  aynı  zamanda  evden  çeyiz  işi  yapıyor.Arkadaşlarının  dükkanında  eliyle  işlediği  çeyiz  malzemelerini  satıyor  ve  aldığı  krediyle  toptan  mal  alarak  ürün  çeşitliliği  sağlamak istiyor.Hedefi  bir  dükkan  açmak  ve  ürünlerini  daha  çok  insana  satabimek.Yaşadığı  tüm  sıkıntılara rağmen  umudunu  hiç  yitirmeyen,  hep  gülümseyen  ve  asla  vazgecmeyen  bir  yapısı  var.

loans.use: to buy embroidery materials

loans.name: Redmond

texts.en:
Redmond is a recently married 21-year-old male living  in a vulnerable population community. Together with his wife, they live in his parents' very small house along with his brother.  He lives with his parents and his brother together with his wife in the same house. His wife is a housewife, helping around the home and he is a very hard worker, employed as a cleaner in a private company. Despite the fact that he lives in very bad conditions, he is always smiling and trying to stay positive. 

Now he is in need of a loan to renovate some of the rooms and the kitchen because they are very old. This loan will improve the living conditions of his family, and he hopes in the future to find a better paying job in order to save money for his family and future. He is very grateful for the opportunity and thanks all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To renovate rooms and the kitchen

loans.name: Ganimete

texts.en:
Ganimete is a 28-year-old married woman currently living in the in southern part of Kosovo. She has two children, ages 6 and 8 years old, both are attending school. Her husband works as a teacher at a driving school and provides the only source of income for their family, as until now Ganimete has never worked.

However, Ganimete has now decided to open a food store business so that she can add more income to her family and help to take care of their financial needs and future. For this reason, she is requesting this loan in order to buy food products for her store. 

Ganmete’s goals are to open her business and then improve her family’s living conditions. She is very happy for the financial support from Kiva lenders!

loans.use: open a food store

loans.name: Slavisa

texts.en:
Slavisa is 45 years old and married with no children. He is living in one of the minority communities in Kosovo with his wife. For more than 10 years now he has been working in a locksmith shop. He started working in his village when the people were in need for such services and then he had seen that this type of  business is profitable and opened his own shop. 

Slavisa serves all of the people in the community regardless of ethnicity or nationality. During the last 10 years of working hard, his tools have become old, broken and outdated, therefore for the first time, he is requesting a loan so that he can purchase new tools for his work. The loan will help him to increase his income as the new tools will help him to be more efficient and effective in his work. He is hoping in the near future to expand his business and be able to hire some employees. He appreciates this help and wants to thank all of the lenders!

loans.use: To buy new working tools for his locksmith shop

loans.name: Shugufta

texts.en:
Shugufta is a 34-year-old married woman, and a mother of three children. She has been running a clothing sales business for many years. 

She purchases a variety of clothing in bulk quantities and at wholesale rates from the main city, and then sells them to the people in her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothing in her community. 

Shugufta has requested a loan of PKR 35,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different clothing for the winter season; she will take into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. 

She is in her third loan cycle, and hopes to have a good experience with this new loan; she wants to grow her business. 

She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work and efforts in the business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different clothing for the winter season.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of three. She is doing  animal sales and purchase along with her husband. The business has great potential for growth. Saima is actively helping her husband as this business is the only source of income for them. She wants to send her children to school by trying to increase her earnings to afford educational expenses of her children. 

Saima has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase three more heifers to increase her net income. She is currently in her 3rd loan cycle and has a good credit history. She hopes and intends to use that to provide good and quality education and a better lifestyle to her children.

loans.use: to purchase three more heifers.

loans.name: Maqsood

texts.en:
Maqsood is 48 years old and a married woman, running a business of milk selling with her husband for the last 10 years. She has two cows in milk and sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk.  She looks after the cows and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. They are happily doing it together to support their family. 

Maqsood has two daughters and two sons; three of them are school-going. She needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. In order to make larger profits, she has requested a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy one more buffalo to cater for more customers. She hopes to get an increase in the  production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Shamoo

texts.en:
Shamoo is a 53-year-old married woman doing a business of milk selling for the past 20 years. She has four calves and also two cows in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the excess milk. Her business is good enough to allow her to lead a decent life. She has two daughters. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  

Shamoo has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of her family. Shamoo has requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to purchase one more cow and feed for the livestock. It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through support of Kashf. She hopes to have an increase in her production capacity which would ultimately help in generating more cash for fulfilling the family needs.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for the livestock.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 44-year-old married woman, living with her husband and three children. For about 20 years she has been doing hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

Shakeela has requested a loan of Rs. 35,000 to buy reels of thread and packs of beads, sequins and stones in different colors for embellishment. She is currently in her 3rd loan cycle and has a good repayment history. In this way she would be able to cater for more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. Shakeela dreams for her children's bright future and desires to provide them with good, quality education.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread and packs of beads, sequins and stones in different colors.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is 29 years old and married. She has five children (and one of her sons is shown in the photo with her).  

She runs a small general store in her community for meeting her household expenses.  She offers variety of grocery items at reasonable prices, and she has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked, she has requested a loan for PKR 35,000 that she will use to buy stocks of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

She wishes to use part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Nasrin

texts.en:
Nasrin is 46 years old and married. She has five children.  She is striving hard to meet their demands, including food, clothing, and health. Her husband is employed with a low salary, too low an income to meet the daily expenditures of the family. 

Nasrin started her business of sewing clothes with her daughter (who is also shown in the photo). She is well familiar with the stitching techniques and enjoys a great client list. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. 

Currently she is in her fourth loan cycle, and she has applied for a loan of PKR 15,000. This will help her to purchase spools of threads, zippers, and elastic material. So then she will be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail.  

She hopes to grow her business and dreams of improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase spools of threads, zippers and elastic material.

loans.name: Fahmeeda

texts.en:
Fahmeeda is a 45-year-old married woman. She is a vigorous lady and, for the past two years, has been running a business selling clothing. She buys clothes of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the wholesale market and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Fahmeeda is requesting a 30,000 PKR loan from Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. Fahmeeda expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is 35 years old and a married woman; she is a hardworking mother of four children who is helping her family by providing tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for many years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

Farzana is in charge of providing her family with good food, health and clothing. She has steadily improved her business by taking loans from Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 to buy more spools of thread in various colors along with packs of laces and zippers. She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history.  She hopes to have more profits and hence better support her family.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in various colors along with packs of laces and zippers.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida, age 23, is a married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband; both are doing business selling spices, which are commonly used in food for taste. They purchase spices in bulk from wholesale markets and then sell their packs in various sizes to the people of their community. They have become well-known by providing good quality spices in their locality, and earn enough to support a decent life. They have two children and need to earn more to cover daily expenditures of the family members. 

For this reason, Zahida requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy a stock of salt, red chilies, black pepper and turmeric in large quantities. This will help them to increase their sales. She expects a boost in earnings and wishes to spend part of it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a stock of salt, red chilies, black pepper and turmeric in large quantities.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz is a 38-year-old married woman; she has been doing a business of crockery sales for the past 12 years. She offers various types of crockery such as glasses, dinner sets, bowls etc. She makes sufficient amount of income by selling them door to door in her locality.  For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 15,000. In this way she would be able to purchase more variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls and glasses in various sizes and designs. She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls and glasses in various sizes and designs.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh was born in 1982. She is married and a mother of two. Her husband works at a university. She lives with her family in a place in Jordan called Dair Alla. She works as a hairdresser at her house. Fatima has been selling accessories for one year. She started her project selling a small quantity of accessories to her customers. Now she wants to buy a larger quantity of accessories in order to expand her business and to raise her profit and income to be able to help her husband in covering their children's needs. She doesn't have enough money to do so and for this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of accessories to sell

loans.name: Yeny Elizabeth

texts.es: Yeny, tiene 28 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Yeny lleva 3 años de tener su propio negocio de pulpería, vende productos de limpieza, productos enlatados, arroz, azúcar, manteca, verduras, jabón, condimentos y otros. Con el propósito de incrementar el inventario para obtener mas ingresos a solicitado un préstamo por 25,000 lempiras y quiere comprar arroz, frijoles, manteca, alimento para animales, refrescos, lácteos, embutidos y otros que necesite para vender. El plan de ella es que crezca el negocio y poderles dar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yeny is 28 years old and married with two children. She lives in the municipality of Choloma in the department of Cortes.  For the past three years, she has had her own business, which is a small grocery store that sells cleaning products, canned goods, rice, sugar, lard, vegetables, ham, condiments and other items. 

Yeny is requesting this loan for 25,000 HNL to increase her inventory in order to improve her income. She will use the loan to buy rice, beans, lard, pet food, soft drinks, dairy products, sausages and other items to sell. Yeny says that her plan is to expand her business so that she can give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, lard, pet food, soft drinks, dairy products, sausages and other items to sell.

loans.name: Zarnigar

texts.en:
Zarnigar is a student at the American University of Central Asia, department of Business Administration, and below is her story.

“My name is Zarnigar. When I was a child, my mother was always telling me, 'Always try to help people in need in every possible way.'  I grew up and these words have gradually turned into a goal. In the future, I want to open a charitable foundation. The main mission of this foundation will be construction of modern hospitals in Bishkek. I believe that studying in the department of Business Administration at the American University of Central Asia will lead me toward my goal. While studying in this department, I will learn useful skills that will help me to involve foreign investors and get different grants to build hospitals. I am applying for financial aid - a KIVA loan - which is a good opportunity for each student of AUCA. 

When studying at school I tried hard, so I think my gained knowledge will help me to enroll at the American University of Central Asia. During my studies at AUCA, I will take part in different activities, help other students, and be an active student of social life of AUCA.  My main goal is to be concentrated on achieving my plans, which I described above. Before the construction of hospitals I would like to visit some orphanages to bring joy, entertain and play with children. 

Overall, I want to devote my life to help people. I hope I will get partial financial aid, which could help me bring those thoughts to reality.”

loans.use: To pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Benazir

texts.en:
Benazir is a student at the American University of Central Asia, in the Department of International and Comparative Politics, and below is her story.

"When I was a little girl, one day I wanted to be a teacher, and the next day I wanted to be a doctor. In the sixth grade, I was elected President of my class. I think that was the time when I started to create myself.

I was President of my class for five years. This experience taught me to be a responsible leader; it taught me to work in a team. I was a member of the Debate Club at school. I remember that debates about human rights, terrorism or politics were the most interesting for me. I noticed that headlines about politics or laws always attracted my attention. So, when the time came, I had to make a decision about what I wanted to study at college. In the beginning I was asking my family and friends, but then I thought that it was my life and it was only my decision. 

I started thinking about what I liked and what I was good at. I applied to International and Comparative Politics because this is the program that most attracts my attention among the other programs that AUCA offers. I have always been passionate about such subjects as human rights, international organizations, political violence, terrorism, international law and others that the AUCA International Comparative Politics (ICP) program offers. 

I believe that ICP offers education in a field that will always be important, especially for Kyrgyzstan. Specialists with an ICP degree will be in demand on the labor market. My goal is to have a job of a lifetime, that I will be passionate about and that I will love. I think that if a person has a job that he or she likes that person can be really successful in life. If I have a successful career that I love, my family will be proud of me and I will be happy. My ultimate goal is to create change for myself, my family, friends and my country. 

I was a participant in a program called FLEX [Future Leaders Exchange Program]. Living in America was a life-changing experience. I changed my perception of life; I became more active and ambitious. I started to ask questions and look for answers. I just really came to understand the value of life, the value of the time that we have - time that we cannot waste. 

My American experience was full of things that I had never tried before. For example, I was able to meet people with disabilities. I saw the care system for people with special needs in the U.S and I realized that I had never questioned what was going on with special-needs people in Kyrgyzstan. That experience showed me that I wanted to help people. Maybe one day I will be a governor who will pass acts that will change Kyrgyzstan, or I will work in an international organization that helps Kyrgyzstan. 

There are some financial difficulties in my family though and therefore I am applying for Kiva loan. This Kiva loan will help me to fully dedicate myself to my education and not to worry about the money that will cover my tuition.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Iuliia

texts.en:
Iuliia is a student of the American University of Central Asia, department of Journalism and Mass Communication, and below is her story.

“The first time I went to AUCA was on the 'open day.' I was struck by an amazing and unique atmosphere that prevails at this university. Even the walls emit some kind of furious energy, an energy of joy, desire to learn, to grow and be leaders. Remarkably, there aren’t any universities in our country where it is possible to feel such an amazing spirit of unity and friendship, and a sense that these fifteen hundred students are bold steps to make this world a better place. AUCA also differs in its approach to each student, and a unique system of education. It is the only university in which you can get pleasure from every minute spent here.

I started thinking about the choice of my future profession a long time ago. At first I wanted to be a linguist, then a psychologist, and then a marketer, and finally, I came to the conclusion that I want to be a journalist. I want journalism to be developed in our country. I want to bring the national media to a new level, to do something new in this area. I want to be a journalist, because this profession opens up the world of people and events, and makes it possible for people to rethink their views and opinions, helping them to evolve spiritually and move forward. It shows people all aspects of that which we have to think about. Journalism is some type of self-expression, and by expressing his ideas, a journalist illuminates life changes, over time. A journalist, as a modern educator, brings into our lives novelty and food for thought, so this is a profession where I would like to work.

AUCA provides a lot of different opportunities: perfect knowledge of foreign languages, the ability to make your own schedule at your convenience, and chose subjects which you are interested in. There are prospects for further education and a career abroad. The diverse student cohort at AUCA offers the chance to become acquainted with people of different nationalities, their cultures, traditions, and mentality.

AUCA gives another opportunity; it gives a loan through KIVA, which is a great opportunity for all the students to cover their tuition fees. So, taking an opportunity I am also applying for a KIVA loan, which will help me to cover my tuition.”

loans.use: To pay her tuition and study for a degree in Journalism and Mass Communication

loans.name: Dmitrii

texts.en:
Dmitri is a student at the American University of Central Asia (AUCA), Department of Business Administration, and here is his story: AUCA in Dmitri's opinion was the best place to continue his education after he completed Turkish high school. He hopes he will get a quality education and experience vibrant student life at AUCA. He applied to a Business Administration program because since childhood he dreamed of being a businessman who could bring his ideas and dreams to life. Since childhood he has been interested in business. He read biographies of businessmen, watched films, listened to stories about them, and more. As he learned more his dream grew. 

AUCA is the best choice for him because it offers modern methods of education, better study conditions than other universities, as well as English education that could bring his knowledge up to international levels. Throughout his years of study he believes he will have a chance to take lessons from international professors, which will help him in his future work. He also has lots of friends at AUCA and they always tell him great stories about the university, its festivals, holidays, etc. These stories motivated him to enroll at AUCA. AUCA also gives KIVA loans for students who need financial aid. His KIVA loan will cover part of his tuition fees.

loans.use: To pay for his higher education.

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en:
Arsen is the student of the American University of Central Asia and here is his story.

“When I was graduating from the Kyrgyz-Turkish High School, at the end of the year, I got offers from many universities. I got good scores and enrolled in many Universities in Turkey, Malaysia, Europe, but due to financial restrictions I chose Pamukkale University in Turkey for a full scholarship. After four months of studies at the department of Management and Marketing, I had to come back to my home country due to some family reasons. My knowledge, leadership and communication skills are the most important values for being a successful businessman. The BA department at AUCA caught my attention more than other departments. I believe that the business trend in AUCA is based on knowledge and not corruption, which is very important for me. AUCA offers lots of possibilities for realizing my business ideas, organizing various projects, etc. I want to take an active part in the social life of AUCA, take the initiative and direction for me to acquire the knowledge that I am going to use in the implementation of my future projects and business ideas. In our country, even abroad, the majority of graduates of BA programs of AUCA work in good positions that help to keep the BA program one of the most promising areas. Once I finish this program, I see myself as a successful businessman and plan to open my own business centers, as well as launch a number of projects that will help to stabilize the economy of our country.

The only problem that I have is financial difficulties of my family. For this reason, I am taking an opportunity and applying for a Kiva loan, which will help me to cover my tuition fees. Taking the opportunity, I would like to thank AUCA for such a unique program that gives all of its students a chance to get funded.”

loans.use: To pay for my higher education.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a student of AUCA, department of Business Administration, and below is her story. 

“I am entering the most crucial phase in my life; a phase when I need to make significant academic decisions that will have a bearing on my future life and career. My keen interest in the world of business and the way in which companies operate has led me to my intention to pursue my bachelor degree in Business Administration. I believe that Business Administration is the key to successful career development in modern society. It is a subject which particularly interests me, because of its relevance to current economic issues and the potential it provides for employment in many areas. 
I have maintained a consistency excellent academic record that showcases my suitability for further study. Furthermore, my involvement in all classroom activities underlines my interest in expanding my knowledge. When I was in tenth grade I became a president of my high school. Being in this position helped me to gain leadership skills and improved my team-work as I always had to plan events and activities for the people in my school. While considering what career to choose, I was in the process of organizing good-bye-party for graduates. It was here that I began to draw parallels with my organizational skills and the world of Business Administration. Looking back at the holidays I organized, I believe the principles of Business Administration were at the very heart of my actions – effective communication, critical thinking, financial management and human resources. 

My plans for the future include an extended academic relationship with American University of Central Asia, culminating in a Bachelor Degree in Business Administration. Then, I plan to go on to work in a successful, environmentally friendly company, strengthening it with my creative ideas, fostering innovative collaboration. I envision my work as contributing to positive, sustainable social change. I am especially passionate about the need to protect what is left of our pristine environments, and nurture or rebuild what has been destroyed. 

To make all the above mentioned happen, I need a Kiva loan, and it is great that the American University of Central Asia gives its students such an opportunity.”

loans.use: To pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Aizada

texts.en:
Aizada is a student of the American University of Central Asia, and here is her story.

Choosing a university is very important, and maybe even the main step that can influence your life and future. It is as important as a choice of profession. So in order to love your future job, you must not make a mistake, not only with the choice of profession but also with a choice of a proper university. I had a very big desire to study at AUCA and I am happy that my dream came true. AUCA will help me to get the best education, new opportunities and a bright future.

Nowadays education is the main tool to attain all your aims and become a successful person. If in the past the strongest person was one who had a powerful weapon, now it is brains and an acquired education. I think that AUCA has all the resources to give opportunities to students who try to get higher knowledge. One of the most important factors is the professional teaching staff which consists of experienced objective Kyrgyz and foreign professors who give significant knowledge and teach students both theoretically and practically. 

AUCA is a place with new opportunities and new people for me. I can get acquainted with more people and thus, have more possibilities to share my feelings, opinions and just spend a good time with them. Fortunately, this year I had a chance to be a dance instructor for AUCA students in one important event and I found many friends there. I know that because of the American system of education I have an opportunity to choose different subjects and study with different students on each course. When I enter the building of AUCA, I immediately feel an absolutely diverse and very pleasant atmosphere, like I am in another world. Besides, in this university I will have different opportunities, since AUCA provides students with different internships, projects, student programs, clubs and extracurricular activities. 

Unfortunately, my family is unable to cover the tuition fees fully. Therefore I am applying for a Kiva loan. Kiva loans are one of great opportunities that AUCA gives to each student.

loans.use: To pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Meerim

texts.en:
Meerim is a student of the American University of Central Asia, department of European Studies, and here is her story:

“It is very important for a person to choose the right university and profession, that will influence their future life as a whole. If you manage to make the right choice, you will be a successful person. AUCA is one of the best universities in central Asia. I am happy to become part of it, and I think I meet all the requirements. 

At first, studying at AUCA will contribute to realizing my goals. The second one, my faculty is opening for me all the doors to international organizations. And the last one, AUCA has influenced me and my life in some way.
 
Firstly, I have plenty of goals, and I think the American University of Central Asia can help me to realize them. Studying at this university, I will improve my knowledge, confidence, resoluteness, etc. So I can say that there, I will have more opportunities to develop the best personal qualities and features to do everything to reach my goals.
 
Secondly, I have chosen the European Studies faculty, because it is one of the best and strongest faculties in AUCA. I think that the teaching staff and friendly atmosphere at this university will give me advantages to make my life better, improve my academic skills, gain new knowledge, feel a multinational environment, and make a lot of friends from different countries. 

Very smart and pretty people will study in my faculty, so I can compete with them and improve my skills and knowledge to the best. As a result, I will have a lot of opportunities in my future career. I will be able to work and cooperate with the most prestigious organizations and companies that offer interesting jobs and high salaries. I think it is a good chance for me.
 
Another opportunity that AUCA gives to every student is Kiva loans. It is what can make dreams come true. 
I am applying for the loan as well, as I have financial difficulties and am not able to cover my tuition fees fully.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman is a student at the American University of Central Asia, and here is his story.

“There are many good universities in Kyrgyzstan, but I would like to study at AUCA because it is simply the best. Professors and the staff in AUCA pay so much attention to students’ studies. AUCA gives a good opportunity of financial aid to those who cannot afford to cover their tuition fees fully. The professors of AUCA are all high qualified and all graduates find good jobs afterwards. During my preparations for AUCA admission exams I met with current students and people working at AUCA. All people are very polite and have really interesting personality. It was really enjoyable to communicate with them and I really want to study among them.

"AUCA is a heart of education. A lot of interesting and cognitive, local and international events are organized there. I also have friends that study at AUCA and I was curious about their impression of studies there. They rated it very high. They do really like the staff and atmosphere in this university.

"I am keen on debates. There is debate club in AUCA and it is very important for me. I know many debaters from AUCA and I am sure that AUCA will help me to improve my debate skills. AUCA debaters are the best in Kyrgyzstan.

"Another great opportunity that AUCA gives to its students is that it gives loan to cover tuition fees. This loan is given through Kiva and all students entering AUCA are able to apply for it. I also have financial restrictions in my family and am applying for it.”

loans.use: To pay his tuition fees.

loans.name: Maksat

texts.en:
Maksat is a student of the American University of Central Asia, department of Business Administration and here is his story:

“I have chosen to apply to AUCA because it brings innovative ways of education to people that are seeking knowledge.  One of the main things I do really enjoy is that no person is forced to make a decision on his career and life during the entrance to the university.  Personally I was in the middle of cross roads deciding whether to pursue a career in the field of business or engineering.  I was always fond of working in a team, being a leader who inspires everyone and also taking advantage in learning from experiences of others.  I believe both engineering and business are successful when a person can cooperate with others and bring in new different ideas to the table.

Kyrgyzstan is a perfect place for new developing small business because of its location, nature and costs of living compared to other places in the world.  It would be mutually beneficial for Kyrgyzstan and small businesses to help the business grow and expand out to CIS and later on go global.  As a result, the whole world would discover Kyrgyzstan for themselves and if they decide to visit us, they would fall in love with our country from the first visit.  I believe that will help our country achieve and maintain politically stable situation and increase political and economic awareness among people. 

I want to pursue my bachelor degree at the American University of Central Asia, because I think it would be the ideal place for me to understand myself,  and gain invaluable knowledge and experience to further help my country develop.  Hopefully, the AUCA community will help me to build up and shape myself. 

I also want to mention that AUCA gives great opportunities, which is financial aid. I would like to apply for a Kiva loan, which is available for every student of AUCA.”

loans.use: to pay for higher education.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is 41 years old and a married woman and mother of five children; one of her children is shown in the photo with her. She has been running a business of animal sales and purchase with her husband (who is also shown in the picture) for the past 25 years. She basically belongs to a rural family where the people normally depend on agriculture and animal purchase and sales business. 

Zarina buys animals (baby goats and baby cows) at low prices, brings them up, then her husband sells them in the market at higher prices. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently Zarina requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase two more goats to expand her business. She is in her second loan cycle with good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good, quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is 44 years old and a vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. 

Sughran intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate healthier source of income. Sughran is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of this loan investment.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla (pictured here), age 49, works for a flower farm.  She has been married since 1987 and has three children. She lives in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her husband is a driver for a company.
Phalla is applying for a loan of $1,500 to build an additional room in the house where she lives.

loans.use: to build an additional room in the house where she lives.

loans.name: Mirza

texts.en: Mirza is 20 years old and lives with his parents in Imishli. He couldn’t get a higher education and because of that, he decided to start his own business as a farmer. He is growing fruits and vegetables on his own land with help from his brother. Mirza wants to expand his business. The amount of produce he sells is not enough to cover the high demand. He would like to grow more fruits and vegetables to increase his turnover as well as improve the living conditions of his family. For this purpose, he has applied for a 1,800 AZN loan. This will be his second loan and Mirza  has a good client history.

loans.use: to increase his turnover of produce as well as improve the living conditions of his family

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en: Gulnara is 44 years old, married, and blessed with three children who are still in school. Gulnara is a hardworking woman. She has been sewing women's clothing for more than four years. Her elder daughter is also helping her mother in this business. She sews beautifully and carefully, and tries to make her clients happy. Gulnara's husband is a worker, but his salary is not enough to solve the problems of their family. She has been planning for several years to repair her home but doesn't have money to purchase building materials like cement, wood, paint, and so on. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 AZN. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to repair her home

loans.name: Mari

texts.es: Mari, de 38 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Todos ellos viven en la casa que compró hace algunos años en su localidad. Mari es una mujer de principios y de actitud luchadora para el trabajo. Desde los 17 años trabaja como agricultora en terrenos que heredó de sus padres. En ellos produce arvejas, habas, papas, maíz y flores de diversos colores. “Me gusta trabajar en el campo, a mi esposo también, los 2 nos dividimos las tareas”, menciona. Además dice que, la venta de arvejas estos días es  buena porque el precio del saco subió. Con ese dinero podrá comprar más semillas de otros productos, ya que las lluvias empezaron y quiere aprovecharlas al máximo. Mari ya empezó con la siembra de papas, por eso también se esmerará en sus cuidados. Su meta para este año se enfoca en adquirir más semillas y fertilizantes para sembrar arvejas y papas. Por eso requiere de se apoyo. Este es su quinto préstamo con KIVA, en todo este tiempo demostró ser una persona responsable y comprometida con su asociación. Mari, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus cultivos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Mari, 38, is married with two children. Everyone lives together in the house she bought some time ago in her community.  Mari’s a principled woman with a positive attitude towards work.  She’s worked since the age of 17 on land she inherited from her parents growing peas, lima beans, potatoes, corn and various colored flowers.  “I like working in the fields and so does my husband; both of us share the chores,” she mentions.  She also says that pea sales are good now because the price per sack rose.

She will use that money to buy more seeds for other products because the rainy season has begun and she wants to take maximum advantage of it.  Mari has already started planting potatoes so she’ll also intensify her efforts caring for them too.  

Her goal for this year is focused on acquiring more seed and fertilizer to plant peas and potatoes which is why she needs your support.  This is her 5th Kiva loan and she’s been responsible and committed to her association all this time.  Mari will use the 3,000 soles to buy organic manure to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Reydo

texts.es: Reydo, de 44 años está casado con Ana y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Él es un hombre noble y sociable. Se dedica a la agricultura desde que era niño. Manifiesta que ayudaba a sus padres en los cultivos de sus terrenos, desde entonces le agradó esa actividad. Por eso ahora, se encarga de cuidar sus sembríos de papas, maíz, arvejas y flores de gladiolos. Trabaja contento en el campo, al lado de su esposa. Además cuenta con animales de carga que le sirven mucho para su actividad. “Éste mes estoy recogiendo las flores de gladiolos, y los precios son buenos, por las fiestas religiosas”, cuenta. En sus planes está empezar 2 siembras, una de arvejas y otra de maíz, ya que las lluvias empezaron y quiere aprovecharlas al máximo. Solicita de su apoyo para lograr sus objetivos. Este es su quinto préstamo con KIVA, en todo este tiempo demostró ser una persona responsable y comprometida con su asociación. Reydo, invertirá los S/.3500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Reydo is 44 years old, is married to Ana, and has three children who live with him in a house he owns. He is a noble and sociable man. He has made a living from agriculture from the time he was young. He states that he helped his parents with the cultivation of their lands; he has liked this business since then. He is therefore now responsible for caring for his crops of potatoes, corn, peas and gladiola flowers.

He works happily in the countryside alongside his wife. He also has pack animals that are a lot of use to him in his business. “This month I'm picking the gladiola flowers, and the prices are good because of the religious festivals,” he says. His plans include starting two crops, one of peas and another of corn, as the rains have begun and he wants to take full advantage of them. He is asking for your support to achieve his objectives. 

This is his fifth loan with Kiva, and in all of this time he as shown himself to be a responsible person who is committed to his association. Reydo will invest the 3,500 Peruvian nuevos soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer to nurture his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes, de 37 años está casada con Héctor, con quien tiene 3 hijos. Todos ellos viven en la casa que construyeron con esfuerzo desde hace 8 años y se ubica en un anexo agrícola. Mercedes es una madre trabajadora y responsable. Su actividad es la agricultura. No es fácil su labor y más aún con una pequeña hija, pero Mercedes es admirable, y se esfuerza en la tierra. Gracias a esa dedicación ahora cuenta con terrenos de cultivos propios. Por ello siembra papas y arvejas, en mayor cantidad, pero también cultiva maíz, habas y flores de gladiolos pero no es seguido. Además cuenta con 2 toros para el arado y 2 burros para la carga de sus cosechas. Ella y su esposo están muy contentos y felices, puesto que le agrada trabajar en la agricultura, ya que le genera dinero cada cosecha. Por ello está convencida de progresar mediante sus cultivos y, de ese modo ahorrar para adquirir más terrenos y evitar pagar el derecho de alquiler. Sus planes más próximos son sembrar arvejas y papas, para ello solicita otra vez de su apoyo. Este es su quinto préstamo con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Mercedes, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para esparcirlos entre sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 37 years old and married to Héctor, with whom she has three children. They all live in the house they built with effort eight years ago, which is located in an agricultural zone. Mercedes is a hard-working and responsible mother. Her business is agriculture. 

Her work is not easy and less so with her small daughter, but Mercedes is admirable and she strives to work the land. Thanks to this dedication she now owns her own land that she cultivates. On this land she plants large quantities of potatoes and peas, but she also cultivates corn, lima beans and gladiola flowers periodically. In addition, she has two bulls for the plow and two donkeys to carry her harvests. 

She and her husband are very content and happy, as they like to work in agriculture because it generates money at each harvest. She therefore believes in making progress through her crops, thus saving money to acquire more land and avoiding having to pay rental fees. Her immediate plans are to plant peas and potatoes; this is why she is asking for your support once again.

This is her fifth loan with Kiva, and she feels grateful for the financial support she receives to get ahead. She also commits to making her payment in a punctual manner. Mercedes will invest the 3,000 Peruvian nuevos soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer to scatter among her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Epifaneo

texts.es:
Epifaneo, de 67 años es viudo. Hace muchos años su esposa falleció y por ello no pudo tener hijos. Él vive en una casa propia, que construyó con mucho esfuerzo en un anexo agrícola. Él es un hombre de mucha fuerza. Su edad no es impedimento para dedicarse a la agricultura. Una actividad muy cansada para muchos, pero para éste hombre es más que una fuente de ingresos, ya que toda su vida la pasa en el campo. Sus principales cultivos constan de papas, arvejas, flores de gladiolos y habas. Pero manifiesta que le conviene sembrar arvejas y flores de gladiolos, por la rapidez en su crecimiento y por la poca inversión. Casi siempre trabaja solo. Por eso cuenta con caballos y burros que le ayudan para trasladar sus cosechas. En ocasiones, en el caso de las cosechas tiene que recurrir a contratar personal. Él espera continuar con su actividad, por que le agrada lo que hace, por eso esta vez iniciará una siembra de arvejas y habas, para ello solicita de su apoyo.
Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva, en todo este tiempo demostró ser una persona responsable y comprometida con su asociación. Epifaneo, invertirá los S/.4500 en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Sixty-seven-year-old Epifaneo is a widower.  His wife died many years ago, which is why he was not able to have children.  He lives in his own home, which he built with a lot of effort in a farming annex.  He is a very strong man.  His age is no impediment to his work in farming.  This work is tiring for many people, but for this man it is a source of income, as he has spent his whole life in the field.  His main crops are potatoes, peas, gladiolus flowers, and broad beans.  The easiest crops to plant are the peas and the gladiolus flowers because they grow fast and require little investment.  He almost always works alone.  Because of this, he has horses and donkeys to help him transport his harvests.  Sometimes during the harvest season he has to hire help.  He hopes to continue with his work because he likes what he does.  This time he will start a planting of peas and broad beans, which is why he is asking for help.  

This is his third loan with Kiva and throughout this entire time he has proven himself to be a responsible person who is committed to his communal bank.  Epifaneo will invest the 4,500 soles in organic fertilizer to treat his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Abboud

texts.en:
Abboud is a 19-year-old single man who has had a mobile-phone shop since 2011. He also sells prepaid cards and new released mobiles accessories; he is also specialized in making necessary technical maintenance.

At the beginning he had difficulties in expanding his work, because of the wide competition around him. Abboud proved to be skillful, with a special customer service that strengthens his position among others.

He is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase his mobile phones capital through buying new released items to reply better to his customers' needs.

As for the future, Abboud is hoping to expand his working place through moving to a wider one, and diversifying his products to attract new customers. He would also like to open a separate maintenance department.

loans.use: to increase his mobile phones capital through buying new released items to reply better to his customers' needs.

loans.name: Zaki

texts.en:
Zaki is a 23-year-old single young man. For the past four years, Zaki has been working in a barber shop he owns. He took this experience from his previous job. Zaki likes his job and tries to always improve it. 

Zaki took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy furniture and make new decorations for his barber shop. This will improve his business conditions and attract more customers. 

Zaki appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy furniture and make new decorations for his barber shop.

loans.name: Sériba

texts.fr:
Né en Octobre 1960 à Tinzanadougou préfecture de Sikasso, Monsieur Sériba est marié et père de 7 enfants, il réside avec ses deux épouses et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Sériba  après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, s’est initié aux activités d’achat et de vente de bétail il y’a environ 9 ans. Il mène cette activité au marché de bétail à Sikasso où il vend des  (moutons, chèvres, etc.). Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de son bétail. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il  y a environs trois ans, il est à son quatrième prêt individuel.
Ce quatrième  prêt servira à acheter 50 ovins dans les localités environnantes qui sont entre autres (Bamoukou, Kléla, Koro Barrage, etc.)
Avec ce prêt il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born in October 1960 in Tinzanadougou, Préfecture de Sikasso, Mr. Sériba is a married father of seven children. He resides with his two spouses and their children in a large traditional extended family in Sanoubougou I, a working-class district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having run several businesses without success, Mr. Sériba became familiar with the business of buying and selling livestock about nine years ago. He operates this business at the livestock market in Sikasso, where he sells sheep, goats, etc. He is much in demand by customers for the quality of his animals. 

To satisfy his burgeoning customer base, he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso about three years ago and is now on his fourth individual loan. This fourth loan will be used to purchase 50 head of sheep from surrounding towns, including Bamoukou, Kléla, Koro Barrage, etc.

With this loan, he envisions making a monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA that will be used to help cover family expenses, repay the loan interest, and invest the remainder in his business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to trade

loans.name: Djenebou

texts.fr:
Née en Janvier 1980 à Sikasso, Madame Djenebou est une femme mariée et mère de 4 enfants résidant avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une famille nucléaire à Hamdallaye Zantiguibougou un des quartiers péripherique de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Cette femme après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès s’est initiée aux activités de vente de pagnes wax et des ustensiles de cuisine il y a environ 11 ans. 
 Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ un  an. Après des prêts solidares (prêt du groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est à son premier prêt individuel.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
Ce premier prêt lui permettra d’acheter 10 pièces de pagnes wax, 7 complets de tissus brodés et 5 colis de tasses à Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso) et qui seront vendus à Sikasso de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmmes.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 85 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Born in January 1980 in Sikasso, Ms. Djenebou is a married mother of four. She resides with her husband and their children in a nuclear family in Hamdallaye Zantiguibougou, a suburb of Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having run many businesses unsuccessfully, this woman became familiar with the business of buying and selling Wax 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and kitchen utensils about eleven years ago.

Concerned about better satisfying her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso about a year ago. After solidarity loans (group loans) in a women's association in her district, she is now on her first individual loan. This initial loan will enable her to purchase 10 lengths of Wax 'pagne' cloth, 7 outfits of embroidered fabrics, and 5 packages of basins in Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso). These goods will be sold door to door to a customer base composed essentially of women in Sikasso.

With this loan, she envisions making a monthly profit of 85,000 francs CFA that will be used to increase her working capital, help cover family expenses, and pay back the loan interest.

loans.use: to purchase Wax 'pagne' cloth, embroidered fabrics, and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Yacouba

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yacouba est âgée de 50 ans, mariée et père de 5 enfants, il réside avec son épouse et ses enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Wayerema Zone, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Yacouba  après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,  s’est initié à cette activité de couture il y’ a 24 années. Son atelier de couture se trouve à Wayerema Zone où il dispose déjà de 6 machines dont 3 machines de broderie et 3 machines simples. Monsieur Yacouba est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses services. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso environs quelques années. Il sollicite ce troisième prêt individuel qui lui permettra d’acheter 1 machine de broderie, 2 machines simples et des tissus pour en coudre et ensuite les revendre afin de mieux répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter. 
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 95 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Yacouba is 50 years old, married, and the father of five. He resides with his wife and his children in a large traditional extended family in Wayerema Zone, a suburb of Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having run many businesses unsuccessfully, Mr. Yacouba became familiar with the business of sewing about 24 years ago.
