Alfredo takes very good care of them, since the rest of the day he works as a doorman at a local school. He hopes to improve his earnings with quality animals. He also hopes to have more animals, so he plans to invest in buying more animals. This is his second loan with KIVA. He is thankful for the opportunity to make progress, promising to be punctual with his payments. Alfredo, will invest the 1000 Peruvian Soles in buying sheep to increase his earnings.

loans.use: to buy sheep to raise.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 48 años vive en compañía de sus 3 hijos a los que cuida en la casa que heredó de sus padres hace 20 años aproximadamente. La actividad económica que realiza es la siembra de diversos alimentos como papa, maíz y en su mayoría alfalfa para alimentar a sus animales. Comenta que al principio no tenía muchos contactos  y aunque los cultivos eran saludables ella tenía pocos compradores, ahora comercializa la mayoría de sus cosechas en la capital donde viaja de manera constante. Ahora desea mejorar sus ingresos pues es una mujer que se dedicó a la agricultura desde muy niña y tiene todos los conocimientos para salir adelante. Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA. Agradece la oportunidad de progreso, prometiendo ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. María, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: María is 48 years old. She lives with her 3 children, who she cares for in the house that she inherited from her parents approximately 20 years ago. She works sowing diverse foods, such as potatoes, corn, and alfalfa to feed her animals. She says that at first she didn’t have many contacts, and although her crops were healthy, she had few buyers. Now she sells the majority of her harvests in the capital where she constantly travels. Now she hopes to improve her income. She is a woman who has worked in agriculture since she was a young girl, and she has all the knowledge she needs to get ahead. This is her second loan with KIVA. She is thankful for the opportunity to make progress, and she promises to be punctual in making her payments. María will invest the 2000 Peruvian Soles in buying organic fertilizer to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 23 años es un joven responsable. Vive en compañía de sus padres a los que cuida con mucho amor en la casa de ellos desde que nació. Desde las primeras horas del día se dedica al trabajo en una escuela de la localidad, donde realiza trabajos administrativos, ya comenzó a trabajar desde hace muchos años, gracias a ellos ahora se encuentra estudiando y ahorrando dinero para poder abrir un negocio propio, desea continuar con lo que aprendió desde pequeño, “la agricultura o ganadería”, espera poder concretar sus objetivos pues es un joven emprendedor. Ahora desea invertir el dinero en la mejora de la casa de sus padres. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA y agradece la oportunidad de progreso, prometiendo ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Además gusta de pertenecer a su asociación, donde todos son unidos y solidarios. Juan, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de materiales tales como cemento, arena, ladrillos, entre otros, para mejorar las paredes de su vivienda con una más resistente.
texts.en:
Juan, 23, is a responsible young man living with his parents who he cares for with much love in the house he was born in.  He works in a local school doing administrative chores starting very early in the morning.  He started working many years ago and thanks to that he’s now studying and saving money to open his own business.  He wants to continue with what he learned as a boy: agriculture or animal husbandry.  He expects to reach his goals because he’s a young entrepreneur.  

At present, he wants to invest in making some home improvements to his parents’ house.  This is his first Kiva loan and he’s grateful for this progress opportunity and promises to be punctual with his payments.  He enjoys belonging to his association where all are united and mutually supportive.  Juan will use the 1,000 soles to buy supplies like cement, sand and bricks, among others to improve the house’s walls and make them stronger.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Rene Vitelio

texts.es: Rene  de 56 años de edad es un hombre trabajador, responsable y  honesto, él posee una pequeña farmacia donde vende medicina popular y natural ubicada en el mercado que se encuentra cerca lugar de residencia tiene varios años de tenerla  posee mucha clientela que lo prefieren por la calidad de productos que comercializa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, Rene esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de medicinas por mayor y poder obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rene, 56, is a responsible, honest and hardworking man. He owns a small pharmacy where he sells over-the-counter medicine and natural medicine. It's located in the market, which is close to his home. He has had the pharmacy for many years. He has many customers who prefer him for the quality of the products he sells. With what he earns from his sales he can afford some of the costs of his home. He lives in his own house with his wife and their four children. 

Rene is applying for a loan for the bulk purchase of medicine and to be able to obtain more income to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy medicine in bulk.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru: Зарина родилась в 1991 года. Она замужем. Ее муж плотник. Они живет на севере Таджикистана, и воспитывают прекрасного сына. Зарина не имеет высшее образование, так как у нее не было возможности поступить в университет. Она дома занимается шитьем женской одежды. Зарина шить как национальные одежды, так как и европейский стиль одежды. Зарина с бизнесом справляется сама. Она очень трудолюбивая женщина и поэтому она кроме шитья женской одежды занимается и откармливанием скота. Зарина хочет отремонтировать свой дом и создать нормальное условие для своего ребенка. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Zarina was born in 1991. She is married. Her husband is a carpenter. They live in northern Tajikistan, and raise a wonderful son. Zarina has no college education since she did not have the opportunity to go to the university. She works sewing women's clothes at home. Zarina sews both traditional dresses as well as European-style clothing. Zarina handles the business herself. She is a very hardworking woman and therefore works not only sewing women's clothing, but also fattening cattle. Zarina wants to renovate her house and create normal living conditions for her child. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 KGS to buy construction materials such as cement, wood, etc. She's awaiting your kindness and hoping for your mercy.

loans.use: buy building materials such as cement and wood for repairing her house

loans.name: Ndeye Mariam

texts.fr: Mme Ndèye Mariam est une jeune femme mariée et malgré son jeune age elle s’efforce de faire du commerce. Elle a une expérience de 2ans dans le commerce. Ndèye sollicite ce montant pour acheter des habits, chaussures et sacs pour enfants et les revend. C’est elle qui paye son loyer et les frais de ses enfants. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 20h, elle veut à l’avenir un grand cantine au marché pour augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les  conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Ndèye Mariam is a young married woman. Despite her young age, she works hard in her business. She has 2 years of business experience.

Ndèye is seeking this loan in order to buy children’s clothing, shoes and bags that she will then resell. She is the one who pays rent and supports her children. 

Her days start at 8 a.m. and end at 8 p.m. In the future, she hopes to open a large shop in the market so that she can increase her income and provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy children's shoes and bags to resell.

loans.name: Mouhamed Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Monsieur Abdoulaye est un jeune homme qui évolue dans la vente des aliments de bétail. Il a une expérience de 5ans dans son commerce. Abdoulaye demande ce crédit d’un montant de 250.000 F pour acheter du mais, mil, blé, foin etc….. pour les revendre. Il est célibataire et n’a aucunes charges familiales.  Il commence sa journée à 8h pour rentrer à 18h. Il souhaite à l’avenir s’acquérir d’une autre cantine pour augmenter ses revenus et  pouvoir marier et avoir des enfants.
texts.en:
Abdoulaye is a young man who makes his living selling livestock feed. He has 5 years of experience in this business. 

This loan of 250,000 CFA Francs will allow Abdoulaye to buy corn, millet, wheat, hay, etc., which he will then resell. 

Abdoulaye is single and doesn’t have any family expenses. His day begins at 8 a.m. and he returns home at 6 p.m. In the future, he hopes to buy a new shop in order to increase his income and be able to get married and have children.

loans.use: to buy millet, corn, hay and wheat for resale.

loans.name: Guadalupana 3Ro. Group

texts.es:
La señora Lorenza es casada. De 53 años de edad. No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar. Tiene 4 hijos y de ellos 1 está estudiando. Se dedica a la elaboracion de tejidos típicos como cortes y guipiles hechos a mano. Inició este negocio con su madre y hasta la fecha lleva 25 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de hilos y tela para tejer cortes y guipiles tipicos de la region. En el futuro desea que su negocio crezca y contar con empleados para producir por mayor.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la elaboracion de tejidos y a la crianza de animales domésticos.
texts.en:
Lorenza is 53 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom attends school.  She did not have the opportunity to attend school herself.  She knits typical clothing by hand, such as guipiles, started this business with her mother, and now has 25 years’ experience.

She is a member of a group and is asking for a loan so she can buy thread and fabric so she can make typical regional guipiles.  In the future she wants to grow her business and hire employees to produce more.

The other members of the group knit and raise domesticated animals.

loans.use: to buy thread and fabric.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 41 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Evelyn has been farming rice for two years and also earns additional income from hog raising.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 21 years old and married.

Evelyn is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Evelyn has been pig fattening for two years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa is 42 years old and has two children who are in school.

Nelfa is in the agricultural business of pig-raising in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins.

Nelfa has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nelfa would like to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins

loans.name: Gilgene

texts.en:
Gilgene is 32 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Gilgene runs a business buying and selling cellphone accessories in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of cellphone accessories to sell.

Gilgene has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Gilgene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cellphone accessories to sell

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
Vanessa is 33 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Vanessa is in the agricultural business raising ducks in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed and ducks.

Vanessa has been raising ducks for five years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vanessa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and ducks

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a 53-year-old married woman with six children, two of whom are currently in school. 

Juliana is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and pigs for her business.  Juliana has been raising pigs for 13 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Juliana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and pigs for her business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 45 years old and has four children. Helen is married and has three children who are in school.

Helen is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Helen has been farming vegetables for 21 years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Helen would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 56 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lorna is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lorna has been raising pigs for eight years and also earns additional income from food processing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Elvira works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store and raising pigs. Elvira is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her buy-and-sell rice grains business.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

Nenita has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from a general store.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
This cheerful and nice lady is 36 years old and lives in Kapan city. Marine has graduated from Yerevan State Linguistic University and has received a specialty of pedagogue of English Language and Literature. Marine was divorced ten years ago, and since then she is bringing up her two daughters alone (her elder daughter is going to graduate from school, and the second one still studies at school). 

Marine works in several schools as a teacher of English language and literature. She also works at the Institute of National Education, Kapan branch. Marine manages to give paid courses at her home, and she has 25 pupils who study English language and literature, getting prepared for entrance examinations. 

Marine’s elder daughter wants to enter Yerevan Theater Institute, directing department, and Marine asks for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a professional camcorder for her daughter. She also needs to buy a computer and some literature, which she needs during her courses with pupils.

loans.use: to buy a professional camcorder for her daughter, and also a computer and some literature for her courses with pupils.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married parent of 10 children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Gina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like wood, nails, paint, and fishing materials for her fishing business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like wood, nails, paint, and fishing materials

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Eden works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice and sugarcane. Eden is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell to customers. 

Eden has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell to customers.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a herbal products direct-selling business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell for her herbal products direct-selling business.

Margarita has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from a general store.

Margarita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma, a 61-year-old widowed mother of eight children, seven of whom are in school, has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from sugarcane farming.  She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.


Erma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can continue to send her children to college and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish buy-and-sell business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell for her buy-and-sell dried fish business.

Fe has been in this business for nine years. She earns more income from food vending.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida, a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a fishing business in the Philippines for six years, earns additional income from food vending. She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy more fishing nets and other materials for her fishing enterprise.

Loida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets and other fishing materials

loans.name: Yubelis Del Carmen

texts.es: Yubelis, mujer de 36 años de edad, siempre le ha gustado la actividad comercial, por eso desde hace 11 años, con la ayuda de sus esposo empezó a vender mercancías variadas y con ello apoyó el sustento de su hogar conformado por su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 5 a 11 años. Hoy yusbelis vende refrescos, bebidas frías, comidas y accesorios femeninos y para el hogar, de contado y a crédito con una frecuencia diaria desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, a una clientela conformada por vecinos y transeúntes. Yubelis ha logrado con 3 crédito que le ha otorgado la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, fortalecer su negocio pero su sueño de prosperidad va mas adelante que sus posibilidades, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, con el cual comprará ropa interior, cervezas al por mayor, bebidas frías y una vitrina para mantener aun mas ordenado su negocio y exhibir los productos que vende, con ello prevee que en su negocio continúen aumentando las ventas, especialmente en la temporada venidera, en la cual las inversiones se hacen mas productivas, pues usualmente aumenta el volumen de sus ventas a final de año y su negocio es aun mas rentable, haciendo que su credikiva sea muy exitoso.
texts.en: Yubelis is 36 years old and has always liked business, so she began selling various merchandise, with her husband’s help, 11 years ago to help support her household, made up of her husband and three children, ages 5-11.  Yubelis sells soft drinks, cold drinks, food, and women’s and household accessories for cash and credit.  Her customers are neighbors and passers-by.  Yubelis has been able to use three previous loans, through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to strengthen her business, but her dream of prosperity outpaces her possibilities, so she is asking for a Kiva loan to buy undergarments, beer in quantity, cold drinks, and a display case to keep her business more orderly and show her products.  With this she foresees that her business will continue growing its sales, especially in the upcoming season, where she has more sales and volume usually increases at the end of the year.  Her business is more profitable, making her Kiva loan very successful.

loans.use: to buy inventory and a display case.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Roció, quien con su credikiva pasado pudo comprar telas, botones, pellón, hilos en una mayor cantidad. Su producción aumentó y mejoraron sus ventas, sus ingresos y su calidad de vida. Ella dice a los financiadores de Kiva: “Gracias por el apoyo brindado” y pide que sigan insistiendo en los microempresarios. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, mediante el cual comprará insumos de confección, materias primas, para prepararse en la temporada de final de año, época en la cual sus ventas se incrementan y requiere tener dinero para aumentar sus producción y mejorar aun mas su nivel de vida.
texts.en: Thanks you for backing Roció, who used her previous Kiva loan to buy fabric, buttons, sheepskin, and thread in quantity.  Her production increased and her sales and quality of life improved.  She says to the Kiva lenders, “Thank you for the support,” and asks that you continue helping small businesses.  Currently she is asking for a new Kiva loan, which she will use to buy supplies and raw materials so she can prepare for the end of year season, when her sales increase, so she will have money with which to increase her production and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy suppies.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es: Fabiola confecciona ropa familiar, vende productos mediante guías especializadas o catálogos y también útiles de aseo personal, de contado  y a crédito durante todos los días desde hace 23 años. Su negocio inició por iniciativa propia y para conservar la tradición familiar mientras ganaba dinero, para apoyar la gestión de bienestar de su hogar, conformado por su cónyuge y su hijo, hoy de 35 años de edad. Poco a poco Fabiola ha ido agregando a su confección, mercancía variada, pues tiene un mercado doméstico fijo que aprovechar, producto de su relación con los clientes de su confección. Su principal oferta es la ropa interior femenina y masculina y artículos de su catalogo como vestuarios y productos de aseo personal. En la actualidad, está aplicando a un credikiva, crédito número 25 que hace a la  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materias prima e insumos y ropa interior, además de productos de tocador. Con esta inversión planea incrementar su capital de trabajo, para vender nuevos productos, que sus clientes han solicitado, especialmente para la época que se avecina, que es de muchas festividades, navideñas y de fin de año, como grados, encuentros familiares, matrimonios etc.  Con sus anteriores créditos, ha logrado fortalecer su negocio y dar crecimiento de su estructura, fortaleciendo así su imagen personal y empresarial.
texts.en:
For the past 23 years, Fabiola has been making family clothing, selling products from specialized guides and catalogs, as well as personal hygiene supplies everyday in cash and through credit.  She started her business on her own in order to preserve the family tradition while earning money to support the welfare of her husband and son who is now 35 years old.  Little by little, Fabiola has been expanding her business and adding more variety to her merchandise.  Thanks to her relationship with her clientele, she has been able to take advantage of the domestic market.

Her primary offerings are underwear for women and men, products from her catalog such as clothing, and personal hygiene products.  She is currently seeking a Kiva loan, her 25th loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to purchase raw materials and supplies, underwear as well as toiletries.  With this investment, she plans to increase her working capital in order to sell new products that her clients have requested for the upcoming season which has many festivals, Christmas and New Year's as well as graduation, family gatherings, weddings, etc.  With her previous loans, she has been able to strengthen her business and grow its structure, which strengthened her personal and business image.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials, supplies, underwear and toiletries.

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sonia de 47 años de edad vende ropa en general y también prepara el famoso  “Peto”, deliciosa mazamorra de maíz pilado que contiene los siguientes ingredientes: 1½ taza de maíz blanco
1½ taza de azúcar, 2 ½ tazas de leche, ½ cucharadita de sal, 1 astilla de canela, 4 tazas de agua, 
preparado de la siguiente manera: Se remoja el maíz desde la noche anterior. Se cocina en olla de presión en el agua y la sal por 25 minutos. Se le agrega leche y el azúcar, se baja el calor sin dejar de remover, dejándolo un poco espeso. Sonia tiene 20 años de experiencia en  su negocio , la cual nació al observar a sus amigos que se dedicaban a ella, generando ingresos. Con una familia conformada por su cónyuge y 3 hijos, hoy en las edades de 22 a 28 años, decidió emprender estas actividades para agregar satisfacciones a su hogar. En la actualidad Sonia está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará insumos para prepara peto, como maíz, azúcar, sal, canela y mercancía variada como suéteres, calzado y colonias. Con su credikiva sus ventas se incrementarán y obtendrá mayores utilidades pues es una nueva inversión, porque su meta es continuar su crecimiento y ampliando los montos de los créditos futuros.
texts.en:
Sonia is 47 years old and sells clothing. She also prepares the famous “Peto,” a delicious boiled maize dish that contains the following ingredients: 1½ cups of white corn, 1½ cups of sugar, 2 ½ cups of milk, ½ teaspoon of salt, 1 pinch of cinnamon, and 4 cups of water. It is prepared in the following way: 
She soaks the corn the night before. She cooks it in a pressure pot with water and salt for 25 minutes. She adds the milk and sugar, and lowers the heat, continuously stirring until it thickens a little. Sonia has 20 years of experience in her business, which she started when she saw her friends generating income in the same business. With a family made up of her spouse and 3 sons, today ages 22 to 28, she decided to undertake these activities to add satisfactions to her home. Now Sonia is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing she is doing with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it buy supplies to prepare peto, such as corn, sugar, salt, and cinnamon, as well as various merchandise like sweaters and footwear. With her Kiva loan, her sales will increase and she will obtain greater utilities, since it is a new investment. Sonia's goal is to continue growing and increasing the amounts of future credits.

loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare peto, such as corn, sugar, salt, and cinnamon, as well as various merchandise like sweaters and footwear.

loans.name: Ludis Isabel

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Ludys en su confección, porque ahora con la máquina industrial que compró con su credikiva, ha logrado mejorar los tiempos productivos, aumentar el volumen producción e incrmentar la buena imagen del taller. Ella dice a los financiadores de Kiva, que “Espera seguir contando con su apoyo,  y que,  muchas Gracias“ En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento, que invertirá en adecuaciones locativas, con lo que pretende aprovechar mas efectivament los espacios del negocio y esto es justamente el éxito de su inversión.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Ludis in her sewing.  Now with the industrial machine she was able to purchase with her Kiva loan, she has been more productive, increased her production volume and improved the image of her workshop.  Her message to the Kiva lenders is " I hope to continue counting on you support, and thank you very much." 

She is now seeking a new loan which she will invest in remodeling her workshop with the goal of being able to use her workspace more efficiently.

loans.use: remodel her workshop

loans.name: Mayerlin

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Mayerlin en su actividad comercial;  desde que recibió su credikiva, su negocio  ha mejorado notablemente;  gracias a las ventas que pudo efectuar, su vida mejoró y esto es muy bueno para ella. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, para comprar ropa, perfumes y artículos que potencialicen su venta a finales de año. Su inversión planea ser exitosa, porque la hace, preparándose para responder a la temporada más comercial del año y basada en los pedidos de su clientela, a la que Mayerlin está dispuesta siempre a complacer.
texts.en: Thank you for supporting Mayerlin in her commercial activity.  Since receiving her Kiva loan her business has improved noticeably.  Thanks to the sales she was able to have her life improved and this is very good for her.  She’s currently applying for a Kiva loan to buy clothes, perfume and other items for end of year sales.  Her investment will be successful because she’s making it in preparation for the year’s best commercial season and because it’s based on orders from customers that Mayerlin is always ready to satisfy.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfume and other merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 53 years old. He is married with three children. They all attend schools. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house. He is expecting to give added value to the cereals he sells in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is 41 years old. He is a father of four children aged between seven and fifteen years. With the loan, he would like to buy more sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 37 years old. He is single, selling different items such as sugar, and soaps. He has requested the loan, to buy more soap to sell. 

He plans to use the profits to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is aged 34. She is married, and has been in the business for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, flour and salt to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy rice, flour and salt to sell.

loans.name: Marie Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 49 years old. She is married with four children aged between 19 and 25. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, and soap to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more rice and soap for sale.

loans.name: Daisy Marilys

texts.es: Daisy, tiene 34 años de edad, es casada, tiene cinco hijos y reside en el municipio de Morazán, Yoro. Hace 12 años que se dedica a la venta de mercadería (camisas, blusas, jeans, short, etc.) y a la confección de ropa como vestidos, blusas, pantalones y otros trajes que soliciten. la ropa la vende de forma ambulante y por pedidos. El prestamo que solicito es por 5,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de mas mercadería como pantalones, camisas, blusas, y también para reparar la máquina de costura. Este le ayudara a surtir mas el negocio y asi poder satisfacer a los clientes. Su meta es mantenerse siempre con el negocio de venta de mercadería y confección y poderle dar apoyo a sus hijos con la educación.
texts.en:
Daisy, 34, is married and has five children.  She lives in the town of Morazán and for 12 years has earned a living selling merchandise (shirts, blouses, jeans, shorts, etc.) and making clothing such as dresses, blouses, pants, and other outfits on request.  She sells the clothing on foot and on order.

Daisy requested a loan for 5,000 lempiras [HNL] to buy more merchandise such as shirts and blouses and to repair her sewing machine.  This will help her stock her business and satisfy her customers.

Daisy's goal is to always support herself by selling merchandise and sewing clothing, and to be able to help her children with their education.

loans.use: to buy clothing and to repair her sewing machine

loans.name: Dovico

texts.en:
Dovico is 28 years old and he is married, with two children. 

He earns income mainly from the sale of crops and he gets a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge worker (CKW). 

Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area, including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases, and agricultural tools. On his land, Dovico grows cassava, beans, maize, and bananas. He also rears pigs, goats, and chickens. 

Dovico has served as a CKW for the last two years and now looks forward to renewing his contract for the next three years. As a CKW, he will use the loan to buy materials for his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging solution, and weighing scale), to share agricultural information about best farming practices with the community. 

With the additional income he will earn as a CKW, Dovico will be able to pay school fees for his children and buy more land. His biggest dream in life is to utilize his farmland more effectively, to increase production for food, security, and for sale.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale, so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Remegio

texts.en:
Remegio is 30 years old and is married with three children. He earns income from the sale of crops and livestock and earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge worker (CKW). 

Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. 

On his land Remegio grows bananas, maize, beans and coffee. He also has goats and chickens. Remegio has served as a CKW for the last two years and now looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale) to serve his village with agricultural information that will improve crop yields and incomes in his village. 

Remegio will use the additional income he will earn as a CKW to start up a business dealing in farm products. His biggest dream in life is becoming a successful international business man that deals in agricultural produce.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 45 years old and lives with her husband and their four children who are in school. She’s been selling noodles (Indomi) and rice for six years. Her store is in front of her house. She’s a very responsible and friendly woman. She’s thoughtful and hardworking, which is why she has loyal customers. 

Vivian is asking for a loan amount of GHS 1,200 to buy two bags of of rice and one big box of noodles so that she can increase her inventory and sales and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy two bags of of rice and one big box of noodles so that she can increase her inventory and sales and improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Macrina

texts.en:
Macrina and her husband, Manuel, are Mexican artisans who craft decorative wall mirrors with tin repousse and Mexico's traditional Talavera tiles. They would like to stock up on tin and tile so that they can increase production. 

Macrina and Manuel have been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is their story: 

"We've been close to arts and crafts all of our lives, and in fact they are what brought us together. Our technique is traditional handcrafting, but our current designs include decorative items like mirrors, ceiling panels, candleholders, and colonial style lamps. Our inspiration is born in each new style as we create from our ideas for people to enjoy. Our designs are crafted by hand with excellent quality and the unique touch of Mexican handiwork. With each item, we show you our love of life." 

"We appreciate your trust and support with this microcredit. It will allow us to grow our business, and provides the capital needed to employ more artisans."

loans.use: to stock up on tin and ceramic tiles for her mirrors

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 54 years old and lives with her two children who are in school. She’s been selling donuts for ten years. She prepares the donuts in front of her house. She’s a very responsible and friendly woman. She’s thoughtful and hardworking which is why she has loyal customers. 

Grace is asking for a loan amount of GHS 1,000 to buy a bag of flour to prepare donuts so that she can take care of her children's school fees and increase sales and so improve her quality of life. She is showing a sample in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy a bag of flour to prepare donuts.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is an artisan from Mexico who specializes in hand-woven Zapotec rugs. He would like to purchase wool, natural dyes, and new looms.

Alfredo has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is his story:

"I was born in Oaxaca and, along with my brothers and sisters, learned to weave from my parents. I was 12 when I created my first rug and I haven't stopped. I now have my own workshop. I believe the art of weaving Zapotec rugs is unique. My inspiration comes from everything I see around me – the landscapes, nature, people and animals."

"This microcredit will help me expand my workshop and increase production, as well as bring on more weavers. Thank you!"

loans.use: to purchase wool, natural dyes, and new looms for his rugs.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco specializes in handcrafted sterling silver jewelry. He would like to purchase silver and natural gemstones. 

Francisco has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is his story: 

"I am the second generation of jewelers in my family, and now my daughters have also chosen this vocation. My designs are inspired by pre-Hispanic codices and the folklore of my country that I love so much. I sign my work as 'Citlali', meaning 'Star' in the Nahuatl language, so everyone wearing my designs has a star to keep them company." 

"Receiving this loan is very important to us, and we really appreciate it. It allows us to continue doing what we love, and show our pieces to the whole world."

loans.use: to purchase silver and natural gemstones for his jewelry.

loans.name: Janisse

texts.en:
Janisse is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in knitted jewelry. She would like to purchase fine silver and accessories to expand production.

Janisse has been selling through NOVICA since 2013. This is her story:

"Art is something that has been alive in me for a long time. My father was in the military and has a great artistic inclination. From my mother I inherited the ability to knit and craft. I love to knit, and that's how I chose to make jewelry with gemstones. I love the idea of creating objects that people will cherish, or give as gifts during important moments in life. One can always see a great difference between one's first and last pieces of work, and this brings to mind the time when, having little experience in knitting silver, a friend of mine bought a pair of earrings I had made. It turned out her husband thought they were metallic sponges for washing pots! When I first heard about this I felt demoralized. But since I love making jewelry so much, and I believe that practice does make perfect, I decided to carry on and now I feel that my designs are truly appreciated."

"Thank you so much for supporting individual artisans like me with this microcredit. We can develop our art further thanks to you."

loans.use: to purchase fine silver and accessories for her jewelry.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia, 33, lives with her family in the house her husband owns. She and her husband have worked selling palm oil for fifteen years. She has a large client base because of her kindness and hardworking attitude. She’s very well-known where she lives and her work selling brings enough for her to cover some of her household expenses. 

Lydia’s asking for a loan amount of GHS 1,000 to invest in the palm oil business. She wants to buy two barrels of palm oil - which is shown in the photo in a bottle. Her plan is to continue in business and have better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: To buy two barrels of palm oil.

loans.name: Idalia

texts.es: Idalia, tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos y vive en el municipio de La Masica, Atlántida. Lleva 10 años de dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de comidas como ser baleadas (tortillas de harina rellenas con frijoles, huevo, queso), pastelitos, refrescos, desayunos, almuerzos y también vende verduras. El préstamo que solicita es por 20,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de comidas como ser carnes, verduras, harina,arroz, frijoles, huevos, manteca,y refrescos. y así podrá vender mas y obtener mejores ganancias. Su meta es poder sacar adelante a su familia cubriendo las necesidades básicas.
texts.en:
Idalia, 33, is a single mother of three children; she lives in the municipality of La Masica, Atlántida.  She’s been selling fast food like baleadas (tortilla filled with beans, egg and cheese), turnovers, soft-drinks, lunches and breakfasts for ten years; she also sells vegetables.

The loan she’s asking for is for 20,000 Lempiras she’ll use to buy supplies like meats, vegetables, flour, rice, beans, eggs, lard and soft-drinks to make her meals in order to be able to sell more and earn higher profits.  Her goal is to be able to move her family forward and cover their basic needs.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Ma Eulalia

texts.es: Ma Eulalia, tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres y reside en el municipio de Gracias Lempira. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, cultivando granos básicos como jornalera. Ahora tiene su propia finca de café en al zona montañosa. Saca su producción al mercado local para la venta. El préstamo que solicita es el segundo ciclo y es por 13,000 Lempiras,  y lo va invertir en la compra de fertilizantes para asistir la finca de café con el propósito de mejorar los ingresos. Su sueño  es desarrollarse como persona y seguir ayudando a sus hijos  y poder crecer con el negocio.
texts.en:
María Eulalia, 35, is a single mother of three children living in the municipality of Gracias, Lempira.  She’s always worked in agriculture as a day laborer growing basic grains but now has her own coffee plantation in the mountains.  She sells her crop in the local market.  

This is her second loan request and it’s for 13,000 Lempiras she’ll use to buy fertilizer to help the coffee crop aiming at improving her income.  Her dream is to develop as a person, to continue helping her children and to be able to grow with her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Dinavence

texts.en:
Dinavence is 27 years old and is married with three children. She earns an income from crop and livestock sales, and monthly compensation as a Community Knowledge worker (CKW). 

Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. 

On her land Dinavence grows maize, vegetables and bananas. She also rears chickens and pigs. Dinavence has served as a CKW for the last two years and looks forward to renewing her CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging solution and a weighing scale) to disseminate agricultural information to farmers of her village and help them realize higher crop yields. 

With the additional income she will earn as a CKW, Dinavence will buy more land to expand her farming activities and pay school fees for her children. Her biggest dream in life is to become a model farmer and advise her community in better farming practices.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale so that she can provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Suren

texts.en:
Suren is 31 years old. Because she could not have children her husband divorced her and she ended up living alone and she had hard time supporting herself. In 2008 when she divorced she decided to start her own business. She bought a sewing machine and after a while gained an excellent reputation in the neighborhood, thanks to the quality of her work.

When she heard about Izdiharona's qard hassan product for divorced women she took a loan to change her old sewing machine and buy iron to increase her profit.

She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits. The story of Suren and her sewing business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for Economic Development clients.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and iron.

loans.name: Bernardo De Jesus

texts.es:
Bernardo De Jesús, es un joven estudiante de Ingeniería Industrial, él esta solicitando un préstamo para poder cubrir todos sus gastos de educación, esta es su historia:Mi nombre es  Bernardo De Jesús tengo 21 año de edad soy de la Vega, República Dominicana, tengo dos hermanos,  estoy soltero, mi padre trabaja en su negocio vendiendo pollo frito y mi madre es una ama de casa. Ingeniería 
Estoy estudiando la carrera de ingeniería industrial en  UCATECI, esa carrera me llama mucho la atención porque primero me gusta y también tienes diversos campo en donde uno puede desarrollarse en el nivel de ingeniería he tomado 34 materia y la que más me llama  la  atención es   ingeniería de método, mantenimiento producción, neumática dibujo técnico tecnología mecánica, administración etc…
El préstamos es necesario para mí porque es  de gran importancia ya que no tengo los recursos  para poder seguir estudiando, si el  préstamo no me lo prestarían me  vería  afectado ya  que   de algún modo cambiaria mi  vida  en la actualidad dentro de la sociedad.
 Mi meta es ser un ingeniero industrial y hacer especialidad en la parte de  alta gerencia, logística y  ingeniería de método, mi meta personales  son:   ayudar a mi  hermano a ser   profesional y  una de la meta preferida mía es tener a mis padres en un lugar mejor.
 Después de terminar mi estudio le voy a dar gracia a DIOS y a KIVA-FUNDAPEC por darme la oportunidad de  estudiar.
 Trabajar en una empresa industrial en el área que me especialices, ejemplo: logística Ing., de  método o mantenimiento.
texts.en:
Bernardo De Jesús is a young Industrial Engineering student who is asking for a loan to pay all his educational expenses.  This is his story:

My name is Bernardo De Jesús and I’m 21-years-old.  I’m from La Vega, Dominican Republic.  I have two siblings, am single, my father has a fried chicken business and my mother’s a housewife.

I’m studying an Industrial Engineering career in UCATECI.  This field is very attractive to my first of all because I like it and also because it has several areas within engineering one can develop in.  I’ve taken 34 courses and the ones I like best are Methods Engineering, Production Maintenance, Pneumatics, Technical Drawing, Mechanical Technology, Administration, etc.

The loan is necessary for me because it’s of great importance for I don’t have the necessary resources to be able to continue studying.  If I were not to get the loan I’d be affected because my life would change in society.

My goal is to become an industrial engineer specializing in upper management, logistics and methods engineering.  My personal goals are: to help my brother become a professional and my main goal is to place my parents in a better place.

When I complete my studies, I’m going to thank God and Kiva-FUNDAPEC for giving me the opportunity of to study and work in an industrial firm in one of my areas of specialization like, for example, logistics or maintenance methodology.

loans.use: to pay for tuition, textbooks and transportation costs.

loans.name: Purevjav

texts.en: Mr. Purevjav, 55 years old, lives with her husband and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been fortunetelling since 1997 and large number of people visits her per day. Her husband renders taxi service to local people. Her elder sells casual clothes by renting stall at trade center. The house they live in has been deteriorated over the years and they decided to make renovation and extension in preparation for incoming winter. So she is requesting a loan of 7000000 MNT to buy necessary building and insulation materials such as bricks, cements, fiberglass and foam. After renovation and extension, the family will live in comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants are released into air.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials

loans.name: Rahmon

texts.ru: Рахмон молодой и умный человек. Ему 18 лет. Он занимается собственным бизнесом, то есть купле продажей DVD дисков. Он упорно работает, чтобы зарабатывать деньги и помочь родителям по обеспечении семьи. Он всегда хотел получить высшее образование и поэтому он в этом году успешно окончил среднюю школу и поступил в университет. Он поступил в заочное отделение, и он параллельно введет свой бизнес. Он в будущем хочет стать высококвалифицированным специалистом. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет достаточно денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 800 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Rahmon is an intelligent young man. He is 18 years old. He has his own business buying and selling DVDs. He works hard to earn money and help his parents provide for the family. He always wanted to get a college degree, so he successfully graduated from high school and enrolled at the university. He enrolled as a distance education student so he can run his business while studying. In the future, he would like to become a highly qualified expert in his field. He has to pay tuition, but he does not have enough money. He is asking for a loan of $800 US to pay tuition. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: pay tuition

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es: Genoveva, de 25 años es una mujer joven y seria. Vive en compañía de su esposo Paúl, junto con su madre y hermanas a las que cuida en la casa donde nació. Estudió pedagogía en una universidad reconocida, hace poco terminó su carrera y espera poder desarrollar todos sus conocimientos. Su principal trabajo se centra en la agricultura, oficio que aprendió desde niña, ayudando a su mamá en los trabajo duros, de ahí aprendió todo lo necesario para poder desarrollar su trabajo y mejorar sus ingresos, los que le permitió pagar sus estudios y cuidar de su hijo pequeño. Ahora se encuentra en el cultivo de sus productos agrícolas como papa, maíz, alverja y sobre todo papa harinosa que es su especialidad. Este es el segundo crédito con KIVA y agradece la oportunidad de progreso, prometiendo ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Genoveva, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Genoveva, 25, is a serious young woman.  She lives with her husband, Paúl, her mother and her sisters who she cares for in the house she was born in.  She studied Teaching at a well-known university and completed her career a short time ago and hopes to put her skills into practice.  

Her main work is in agriculture, an occupation she learned as a girl helping her mother with this hard work.  She learned everything necessary to carry out her work and improve her income  which made it possible for her to pay for her education and to care for her little boy.  She’s growing potatoes, corn and peas but especially a particular type of starchy potato that’s her specialty.

This is her second Kiva loan and she’s grateful for this progress opportunity and promises to make her payments punctually.  Genoveva will use the 1,000 soles to buy organic manure to nourish her plants.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Meyga

texts.es: Meyga, de 33 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 02 hijos de 12 y 14 años de edad respectivamente.  Vive en compañía de sus hijos en un su casa propia. El trabajo de Meyga consiste en la venta de prendas de vestir, trabaja vendiendo entre sus amigos, vecinos y familiares, empezó desde hace unos 11 meses y hasta el momento le va muy bien. Trabaja cómodamente sin descuidar las labores de su hogar. En esta temporada está ofreciendo vestidos, polos, blusas, jeans, faldas y otros artículos preferentemente para el público femenino. Anteriormente vendía jugos y desayunos en la vereda de su casa. Se siente muy a gusto desarrollando su trabajo ya que su esfuerzo es retribuido en los buenos ingresos que tiene, pero necesita de alguna ayuda adicional ya que se quiere preparar porque se esta  incrementando la cantidad de su mercadería, por fortuna le está yendo bien ya que vende mucho pero a falta de inversión es que no aumentan sus ventas considerablemente, su principal objetivo es hacer que su negocio crezca y sea prospero. Este es el crédito número 01 con kiva, es por eso que agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su financiamiento para realizar su trabajo con mejores resultados. Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles, comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería entre vestidos, polos, pantalones y algunos otros productos que solicita su distinguida clientela.
texts.en:
Meyga, 33, is a single mother of two children who are 12 and 14 years old respectively.  She lives with her children in her own house.  Her work consists in selling articles of clothing.  She sells them to her friends, neighbors and family members.  She started about 11 months ago and to date is doing very well.  She works comfortably without neglecting her household chores.  This season she’s offering dresses, shirts, blouses, jeans, skirts and other items especially for women.  She used to sell juice and breakfasts in her yard.

She feels very good carrying out her work because her efforts are rewarded with the good income she earns but she needs additional help because she wants to prepare because she’s increasing the amount of merchandise.  Fortunately, she’s been doing well for she sells much but lack of investment keeps her sales from rising considerably.  Her main goal is to make the business grow and become prosperous.

This is her first Kiva loan and she’s grateful to all those who make her loan possible so she can work for better results.  She will use the requested 3,000 soles to buy larger amounts of merchandise like dresses, shirts, pants and some other items requested by her distinguished clientele.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Eva Del Rosario

texts.es: Eva es una señora de 37 años de edad, casada que habita en Juigalpa Chontales, tiene a su cargo un hijo menor en edad escolar, ella labora como domestica y su marido trabaja en jornadas agrícolas en las comarcas aledañas, de esta manera comparten los gastos de la familia. Eva desea seguir mejorando sus condiciones de vida, y continuar con la construcción de un anexo en la parte posterior de su casa, para lo cual necesita comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, hierro, piedrín y pago de mano de obra,  de esta manera ella y su familia vivirá en mejores condiciones y comodidad en su hogar.
texts.en:
Eva, 37, is married living in Jigalpa, Chontales.  She has a minor son attending school in her care.  She works as a domestic employee and her husband works as a field hand in nearby farms.  They share household expenses this way.  

Eva wants to continue improving her living conditions and continue building an annex in the rear of her house.  To do so, she needs to buy building supplies like cement, sand, iron rods and gravel and to pay labor costs.  In this way, she and her family will live in better conditions and more comfort at home.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Santa María De Los Llanos Group

texts.es:
La señora Andrea de estado civil casada. Tiene 41 años de edad. De escolaridad primaria completa. Tiene 7 hijos y 2 de ellos estan estudiando. Se dedica a la crianza de cerdos. Inició este negocio desde pequeña ayudaba a su familia a cuidar cerditos y a la fecha lleva 30 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un prestamo que lo utilizará para comprar 4 cerditos y concentrado para los mismos. Desea en el futuro contar con capital de trabajo amplio para tener una granja.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza de animales domésticos.
texts.en:
Andrea, 41, is married and completed elementary school.  She has 7 children two of which attend school.  She works raising pigs.  She started this business as a little girl since she helped her family care for piglets.  To date she has 30 years’ experience.

She organizes a group and requests a loan she’ll use to buy four piglets and feed for them.  She hopes in future to have enough working capital to have a farm.  The other group members work raising domestic animals.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Francisca Susana

texts.es: Doña Francisca es una mujer soltera y trabajadora, que habita en el departamento de Juigalpa Chontales, labora como conserje en un colegio público. Francisca a pesar de su edad lucha por salir adelante, con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ha logrado realizar mejoras a su vivienda, pero aun le falta muchas más; ahora necesita realizar un anexo en la parte posterior de su vivienda, por lo tanto requiere comprar cemento, zinc, hierro piedras canteras para dar inicio a este proyecto, siendo esta la primer etapa de la construcción. Esta mejora permitirá que doña Francisca y su familia habiten en mejores condiciones de vida y en un ambiente seguro.
texts.en: Francisca is a single, hard-working woman who lives in the department of Juigalpa Chontales. She works as a custodian in a public high school.  In spite of her age, Francisca has not stopped fighting to get ahead. With a lot of hard work and sacrifice, she has managed to make a lot of improvements to her home, but she still has many more to go. Her current project is to build an annex in the rear part of her house, which will require buying cement, zinc, steel, and quarried rocks to start, this being the first stage of construction. This improvement will let Francisca and her family live under better conditions and a more secure environment.

loans.use: buy building materials for an annex to her house.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is 41 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Riza has been farming vegetables for one year and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia is 56 years old and married with six children.

Ignacia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ignacia has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from farming vegetables and selling personal products.

Ignacia aspires to save enough money to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Naomie

texts.en:
Naomie is 27 years old and married with two children.

Naomie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

Naomie has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming rice and raising pigs.

Naomie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy farmland to grow potatoes.

loans.name: Milton

texts.es: El señor  Milton tiene 22 años, viene de una familia dedicada a la confección y posterior comercialización de productos de vestir, nació en la ciudad de Cochabamba,  es una persona joven y emprendedora , desde sus diecinueve años comenzó con esta actividad de la confección y comercialización de calzados deportivos, primero con pocas maquinas , siempre conto con el apoyo de sus padres, el señor  Milton se especializo en la elaboración de calzados deportivos, ya  que al ser una persona joven, tenía el conocimiento de la preferencias y moda actual,  por la calidad  de la elaboración de los productos y servicio del señor  Milton, se ha consolidado en el mercado, logrando incrementar su producción con el transcurso de los años, el señor  Milton tiene la visión de armar una pequeña empresa de elaboración de calzados deportivos. Donde puede exportar a otros departamentos del país, el crédito que solicita el señor  Milton es para la compra de máquinas y materiales, de esta manera lograra incrementar su producción.
texts.en:
Milton, 22 years old, was born in the city of Cochabamba and is an enterprising young man. He comes from a family who has long been in the business of making and selling articles of clothing. When he was nineteen, he began the business of making and selling sports shoes, at first with a few machines and always with the support of his parents. Milton specializes in making sports shoes, and as he is a young person himself, he knows the current tastes and fashion.
Through the quality of his goods and services, Milton has created market share for himself and has succeeded in increasing his production over the years. Milton envisions assembling a small company built around making sporting shoes. Where he can export to other departments in the country, this loan that Milton is asking for is to buy machines and materials so that he can expand his production.

loans.use: buy machines to make sports shoes

loans.name: Ruller

texts.es:
Ruller tiene 27 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Tarapoto y para poder salir adelante trabaja como empleado en una empresa de su ciudad en el área de estructuras, metálicas, con lo puede obtener ingresos para poder solventar sus gastos de manutención, Ruller cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable y cuidadoso.

Ruller está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá apoyar a su madre para que pueda operarse ya que se encuentra delicada de salud, de esta manera podrá curar a su madre y trabajar más tranquilo y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Ver a su madre feliz”.
texts.en:
Ruller, 27, lives in the city of Tarapoto and to get ahead works as an employee in a metal shop in town making metal structures.  He earns income this way to cover his support costs.  Ruller believes he does well at work because he’s responsible and careful.

Ruller is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve provided he will be able to pay for his mother’s surgery; she’s in poor health.   In this way, he’ll care for his mother and work with more peace of mind and continue striving to make his great wish reality: to see his mother happy.

loans.use: to pay for surgery.

loans.name: Rosally

texts.en:
Rosally is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her buy-and-sell rice grains business.

Rosally has been in this business for five years. She learns more income from general stores and farming vegetables.

Rosally has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina is 61 years old, married and the mother of seven children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines and is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 from NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as eggs, spices, sugar, coffee, milk, soft drinks, chips, etc. Marcelina has borrowed and repaid three prior loans from NWTF, and has been running her general store for 13 years. She supplements her income by fishing, and hopes to earn and save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more food to sell.

loans.name: Marfely

texts.en: As a widowed parent with one child, Marfely works hard to support her family. She earns a living by buying and selling crabs in the Philippines, and supplements this income by raising pigs.  She is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 from NWTF to buy additional crabs to sell. Marfely has sustained her business with nine prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more crabs to sell

loans.name: Maming

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Maming works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming coconut.  Maming is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like chips, milk, bread, coffee, can goods, etc. for her general store business.

Maming has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like chips, milk, bread, coffee, can goods, etc.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Nenita works hard to support her family.

She has a food market business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Nenita is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF in order to buy more spices to sell in her food stall.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more spices to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Heidy

texts.en:
Heidy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks like rice, sugar, milk, etc for her food vending business.

Heidy has been in this business for 5 years. Heidy earns more income from general store and farming vegetables.

Heidy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like rice, sugar, milk, etc

loans.name: Louella

texts.en:
Louella is 45 years old and married with three children.

Louella works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like soap, sugar, snack foods and other groceries.

Louella has borrowed and repaid 27 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eleven years and also earns an income from farming rice and sugarcane.

Louella aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soap, sugar, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 54 years old, married and the mother of four children. She earns a living by farming seaweed in the Philippines, and has requested a loan for PHP 25,000 from NWTF to buy additional sacks of seaweed to sell. She has been harvesting seaweed for two years and also earns additional income by buying and selling charcoal. She is working tirelessly to attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more seaweed.

loans.name: Anarkhan

texts.ru: Анархан 44 года. Совместно с супругом воспитывают троих детей. В 2008 году, супруги начали бизнес в торговле продуктами питания с арендованного магазина, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 15,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Анархан имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду в бизнесе, супруги смогли выкупить магазин, который раньше арендовали. В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Анархан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) для оптовой покупки продовольственных товаров и прохладительных напитков для последующей розничной торговли. Доходы от кредита Анархан планирует вложить в увеличение товарооборота и накопить деньги на обучение для своих детей в университете
texts.en: Anarkhan is 44 years old. She and her husband have three children. In 2008, the couple started selling groceries in a shop they rented using 15,000 KGS as seed money. Since she has managed to grow her business and find regular customers, Anarkhan has an average monthly income of 15,000 KGS. Thanks to their hard work in the business, the couple were able to buy the store that they rented previously. In order to further improve and expand their business, Anarkhan approached the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 130,000 KGS to buy food and beverages wholesale that they can later resell. Anarkhan plans to invest profits in her business to increase sales and to save money to send her children to university

loans.use: for the purchase of food and beverages for subsequent retail

loans.name: Jay Jagannath Group

texts.en:
This group is called “Jay Jagannath”. It was formed in the year 2009. All five members of this group are women from the village of Badi and belong to the “Below Poverty Line” category. Badi is a rural village in the district of Nuapada of Odisha, one of the poorest districts in India. 

Anuradha is one of the members of the Jay Jagannath group. She is standing on the extreme right and raised her hand in the photo. She is 29 years old and is a cheerful lady. She is living with her husband and three sons, aged nine, seven and five. She hails from a Scheduled Class family. 

Anuradha is running a dairy farm with ten milking cows at her house with the help of her husband. Her husband supplies milk to the Tiffin hotels of the nearest town. He also looks after the health of the cows and takes care of them. Anuradha gets 50 liters of milk on a daily basis. From this business, she gets an income of 10,000 INR per month. 

As there is growing demand for milk in the locality, every year she is adding new cows to her dairy farm. This will be the fifth loan for her from Mahashakti Foundation. She is planning to use the loan to purchase a high breed milking cow with 60,000 INR. 

Anuradha has a dream to save enough money for construction of a house, giving a better education to her children and developing a good dairy farm.

Of the other four members, Mayabati, Khiradei and Arati are running general stores, and Milki is doing a fish business. The group members hope to expand and develop their businesses from the financial support from Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a high breed cow.

loans.name: Maa Gardien Group

texts.en:
Minakshi, aged 27, is an active lady of Tukla village of Nuapada district in Odisha, India. The lady standing second from the right with a raised hand is Minakshi. She is residing with her husband and two sons of 7 and 3 years. 

In the year 2009, she, along with three other members of her village, formed a Joint Liability Group named “Maa Gardien” to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation to add some extra income to their families by expanding their existing businesses. 

Minakshi is running in her village a multifarious business of a tent house with a light and sound system, a tea stall, and a daily needs shop with items like biscuits, bread, mixtures, toothbrushes, toothpaste etc., with the help of her husband. 

During her first loan, Minakshi had a cycle mart, and she was earning a monthly income of 3,000 INR. This is her fifth loan. During her previous four loans, she has been able to diversify her business. She earns a monthly income of 8,000 INR from the existing business. Minakshi says this amount is also not sufficient to meet the present needs of her family. So, to earn some more income, she is planning to add some more items to her present trades. 

From a part of the present loan of 48,000 INR, she will purchase some light and sound systems for the tent house business, and daily needs items like biscuits, bread, mixtures, toothbrushes, and toothpaste from the other part. Minakshi believes she will earn some more income from this investment, which will help her to manage her family smoothly. She hopes to save enough for the better education of her children.

The other three members of the group are Nayan, Pinki and Sabitri, with a fabrication center and tent house, sewing machine selling and repairing center, and auto parts store respectively.

loans.use: to purchase a light and sound system for her tent house business, and  biscuits, bread, mixtures, toothbrushes, toothpaste, etc. for her daily needs shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase production equipment, market her film, hire one part-time and eight full-time employees, and market her film to potential investors.

loans.name: William Darío

texts.es: William es un campesino de 33 años de edad, padre de dos hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a trabajar como empleado en diferentes fincas de la región, desempeñando actividades agropecuarias, allí adquirió experiencia y conocimientos en todas las labores del campo. Hoy en día se dedica a la cría de ganado para la comercialización de leche, actividad que desarrolla desde un terreno que tomó en arriendo, la producción del líquido es vendida y de esta forma genera los recursos necesarios para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Su empuje, empeño y dedicación lo han llevado a buscar opciones que le han permitido salir adelante, aún sobrepasando diversos obstáculos que se le presentan en su labor, pues los precios de venta son bajos y algunas veces no logran cubrir los altos costos de los insumos agrícolas. Sin embargo ha sabido manejar la situación y supera todas las adversidades. Actualmente solicita el crédito como apoyo para continuar con su labor, con el dinero desea comprar más vacas productoras de leche para aumentar su producción y aprovechar al máximo el terreno de pastos que posee para alimentar a los animales, esto le permitirá mejorar las ventas y los ingresos que recibe de ellas, con los que podrá continuar realizando su labor y en un futuro tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y podrá ofrecer una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
William, 33, is a farmworker and the father of two children.  He lives with his common-law partner.  During his working life he has been an employee on different farms in the region doing agricultural work and acquiring knowledge in all the agricultural jobs.

Currently William works raising cows to sell milk, which he does on a plot of land he's renting.  He sells his milk production to generate the resources he needs to support his household.  

His drive, perseverance, and dedication have driven him to look for options for getting ahead, even overcoming a variety of obstacles that come up in his job.  The selling prices are low and don't always cover the high cost of agricultural inputs.  Nevertheless he has managed to handle the situation and overcome the difficulties.

William's requesting this loan to help keep on doing his job.  With the money he wants to buy more dairy cows to increase his production and make the most of his pastures to feed the animals.

This will allow him to improve his sales and his income and to continue doing his job.  In the future he'll have the opportunity to improve his family's living conditions and give his children a better education.
