loans.use: to buy dairy cows

loans.name: María Emilse

texts.es: María, a sus 38 años de edad se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes que inició desde el año 2002 luego de renunciar a su último empleo en una multinacional de alimentos donde se desempeñaba como promotora T.A.T, la causa de su retiro fue una enfermedad crónica que la afectaba, especialmente por los cambios climáticos a los que se veía expuesta. Con la información que adquirió de sus clientes sobre el manejo de este tipo de negocios y con el dinero que recogió entre la liquidación y una indemnización que recibió por el fallecimiento de su padre, pudo completar el capital para iniciar su tienda, en la que trabaja todos los días de 7:30 am a 10:00 pm y tiene la ventaja de estar pendiente de su familia conformada por sus dos hijos y su esposo. Actualmente solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor de productos con larga vida útil (enlatados, productos de aseo, pastas, granos, confitería, galletería, entre otros), además requiere hacer unas mejoras locativas (organizar la fachada del local), así tendrá la posibilidad de aumentar su margen de ganancia por las ventas y dará una nueva imagen al establecimiento, lo que atraerá mayor cantidad de clientes y así mejorará notablemente sus ventas. María desea seguir trabajando arduamente para poder llegar a cumplir el sueño de construir dos pisos más en su casa, uno para independizar la tienda de su hogar y el otro para arrendarlo y así recibir más ingresos que complementen la economía del hogar y le permita ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
María, 38, works in her own business, a grocery store she opened in 2002 after resigning from her job at a multinational food firm where she worked as a T.A.T. saleswoman.  The reason for her resignation was a chronic disease she had that was worsened by weather changes she was exposed to.  With information she got from her clients regarding the way to manage this type of business and with money she got from her severance and from an inheritance she got when her father died, she was able to amass enough capital to start her store where she works every day from 7:30am until 10pm.  The advantage she has is that she’s able to be watchful of her family consisting of her two children and her husband.

She’s currently asking for this loan to buy long shelf-life stock merchandise like canned goods, cleaning supplies, grains, sweets, cookies and crackers, etc. for the store at wholesale to be able to increase her profit margin from sales.  She will also give her establishment a new image which will attract a larger number of customers which will noticeably improve sales.

María wants to continue to work hard to reach her dream of adding two more floors to her house, one to separate the store from the living quarters and the other to lease out to earn extra income to add to her household economy and make possible improved quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise and to do some physical improvements to the store.

loans.name: Noris

texts.es: Don Noris, tiene 67 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su hermano y tres sobrinos en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Anteriormente se dedicaba a realizar trabajos de fotografía y hace 6 meses decidió dedicarse a la venta de comida como ser baleadas, pastelitos, tajadas con pollo frito, y otras golosinas. El préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras y lo va utilizar en la mejora del local haciendo una acera para poder colocar mesas y brindar mejor servicio al cliente. Su meta es seguir ayudando a la familia con el negocio.
texts.en: Noris, 67, is single living with his brother and three nephews in the municipality of Tela, Atlántida.  He used to work as a photographer and six months ago decided to start selling fast-food like baleadas [tortilla filled with beans, eggs and cheese], turnovers, fried chicken with fried plantain and other snacks.  The loan he’s requesting is for 10,000 Lempiras that he will use to make improvements to his locale.  He’ll build a sidewalk to install tables and provide better customer service.  His goal is to continue helping his family with the business.

loans.use: to make improvements to his stall.

loans.name: Rosa Estela

texts.es:
Rosa de 36 años de edad, es casada. Su esposo se dedica a la carpintería. Han procreado cinco hijos, de 16 años  que estudia 9° grado, el segundo tiene 14 y estudia 8° grado, el tercero tiene 12 años y estudia 6°grado, el cuarto tiene 10 y estudia y estudia 4° grado y el quinto tiene 8 años y estudia primer grado. Los dos hijos mayores les toca trabajar y estudiar a la misma vez.

Ella se dedica a los oficios domésticos como empleada, dice que desde que estaba pequeña realizaba oficios domésticos y su mamá la ponía a realizarlos. También se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas y para llegar a su lugar de trabajo se tarda 20 minutos,  viaja en el autobús. De su familia solo ella se dedica a esta actividad, el horario que ella tiene no es estable.  

 El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar unas camas para que sus hijos puedan dormir más cómodamente, esto les permitirá a los niños no estar expuestos a insectos o bacterias que le pueden perjudicar la salud a sus hijos y que sus hijos ya no dormirán en una sola cama.

Su deseo es, tener un mejor empleo para ella y su esposo y vivir cómodamente en un lugar digno para sus hijos y que sus ellos sigan estudiando para que en el futuro sean profesionales, con una carrera universitaria. Todo esto lo lograra con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación con su  esposo.
texts.en:
Rosa, 36, is married and her husband’s a carpenter.  They’ve had five children.  The 16-year-old attends 9th grade, the second one who is 14 attends 8th grade, the third who is 12 attends 6th grade, the fourth who is 10 attends 4th grade and the fifth who is 8 is in first grade.  The two oldest children must work and go to school at the same time.

She’s employed as a domestic employee and says that she’s done domestic chores since she was a girl since her mother would have her do  them.  She also works in agriculture and to get to her place of work takes 20 minutes on the bus.  She’s the only one in her family doing this type of work and she works irregular hours.

The loan she’s requesting is to buy beds so her children can sleep more comfortably.  This will make it possible for her children to be safe from exposure to insects or bacteria that can affect their health because they won’t be sleeping in the same bed anymore.

Her wish is for her and her husband to have better jobs and to live comfortably in a proper place and that her children stay in school so that they can be professionals in future with university careers.  All of this will be accomplished with much effort and dedication from her and her husband.

loans.use: to buy beds for her children.

loans.name: Altansukh

texts.en: Altansukh, 30 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family currently resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. Altansukh has been working as a welder at a power station since 2012. His wife is a janitor and works in a private firm. This summer, they began building a house on their land but due to lack of financing, they didn't manage to finish the building work. So Altansukh is now requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam, in order to complete his house. The house is much better than the Mongolian traditional ger. Also, in a high quality well-insulated house, they will burn less coal for heating thus releasing less pollutants into air.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Mor

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mor est mécanicien de profession. C’est en 1993 qu’il a commencé à apprendre le métier dans l’atelier d’un de ces oncles. Vingt ans après, il ouvre son propre domaine au garage et commence à pratiquer. Il travaille de 10h du matin jusqu’à 23h s’il le faut car il est très disponible pour sa clientèle. Il prend une fois un crédit à l’IMCEC pour compléter son matériel. Actuellement il fait un renouvellement pour la construction d’une salle de peinture dans son garage.
Mor est marié et  père de deux enfants. Il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de sa famille et du confort de cette dernière et veille à ce qu’ils ne manquent de rien. 
Tout ce dont Mor rêve est d’avoir une renommée dans son travail, améliorer ses conditions de travail et son atelier. Cependant, il compte sur l’appui financier d’une institution financière comme l’IMCEC.
texts.en:
Mor is a mechanic by trade, and started to learn this profession in a workshop owned by one of his uncles in 1993. He opened his own space in the garage 20 years later, and started to offer his services. He works from 10 in the morning until 11 at night if he has to, as he always likes to be available for his customers. He already took out a loan from UIMCEC to buy more materials, and has now requested a further loan so that he can build a painting room in his garage.

Mor is married and a father to two children. He provides for his family’s daily expenses and ensures their comfort, so that they never have to want for anything. Mor’s dream is to become well-known in his line of work, as well as to improve his working conditions and his workshop. To do this, however, he relies on the support of a financial institution like UIMCEC.

loans.use: To build a painting room in his garage.

loans.name: Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es:
La señora Ana de estado civil unida de hecho. De edad 53 años. No le dieron la oportunidad de estudiar. Tiene 7 hijos y 2 de ellos estan estudiando. Se dedica a la siembra de ejote y tomate. Inició este negocio juntamente con su esposo despues de poco tiempo de unirse, a la fecha lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y siolicita un prestamo que lo utilizará para la compra de fertilizante para sus cosechas. Desea en el futuro exportar sus productos al extranjero.

Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a actividades agricolas y al comercio.
texts.en:
Ana’s in a de facto marriage.  She’s 53-years-old.  She never had the opportunity to go to school.  She has 7 children two of which attend school.  She works growing green beans and tomatoes.  She started the business together with her husband shortly after they got together and to date has 10 years’ experience.

She organizes a group and requests a loan to buy fertilizer for her crops.  In future she’d like to export her products abroad.  The other group members do agricultural work or are merchants.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Samuel De Jesus

texts.es: Samuel de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija de 13 años de edad ella estudia actualmente, él posee un negocio en el que comercializa gas propano en su casa de habitación, gracias a este trabajo es como él puede costear los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, también Samuel  recibe llamadas telefónicas solicitando sus servicios, por lo que él lleva los cilindros de gas en su moto hasta la casa de sus clientes. Samuel con todo el deseo de hacer crecer su negocio solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL por medio del cual pueda invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de cilindros de gas, con lo que podrá atender a más clientes y así obtener más ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Samuel, 40, lives in his own house with his wife and 13-year-old daughter who is currently attending school.  He has a home-based business selling propane and thanks to this work he’s able to cover household expenses.  Samuel gets phone calls requesting his services and he uses his motorcycle to home deliver the gas tanks to customers.

Samuel very much wants to make the business grow and is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy a larger number of gas tanks to increase the number of customers he can serve and earn higher profits to give his family better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger number of gas tanks.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Rona works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from running a general store and farming rice. Rona is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF in order to buy more items like blouses, pants, curtains, and other ready-to-wear clothing for her clothing sales business.

Rona has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy clothing items for her clothing sales business

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a farmer from the town of Ubay, Bohol. She is a widow and has three grown up children. Carmelita has been in the farming business for more than 6 years now. This is the source of her income.

Carmelita is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this loan, Carmelita will be able to improve the productivity of her farm thus augmenting her yield and profit. In the future, Carmelita hopes to make her farming business a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Leciel

texts.en:
Leciel is 34 years old and married with four children.

Leciel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling nipa rooofing in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of nipa to sell.

Leciel has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell nipa rooofing business for 6 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Leciel aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy and sell nipa roofing.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 62 years old, married and has six children.  

Concepcion is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Concepcion requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Concepcion has been farming rice for eleven years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Concepcion would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Ilyn is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, milk, canned goods, and eggs for her general store business.

Ilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 50 years old and married, with eight children.

Veronica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Veronica has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years, and she also earns an income from farming rice.

Veronica aspires to save enough money to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ruby Ana

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ruby Ana works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a boarding house for renting. Ruby Ana is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned good, eggs, noodles, and chips for her general store business.

Ruby Ana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Seonilyn

texts.en:
Seonilyn is 34 years old and married with five children.

Seonilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling rice grain in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grain to sell.

Seonilyn has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business for one year, and she also earns an income from farming coconuts.

Seonilyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grain to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 59 years old and married, with six children. 

Delia is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Delia has been farming rice for six years now, and she has borrowed eleven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her efforts.

In the future, Delia would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Marta Lilian

texts.es:
Marta de 39 años de edad,  es casada y no sabe leer ni escribir.  Su esposo se dedica a la albañilería y ella se dedica a los oficios domésticos,  han procreado 2 hijos un niño de 5 años y una niña de 16 años que está cursando octavo grado en el centro escolar. Actualmente, los niños no trabajan solo estudian, la distancia de su vivienda al lugar del cultivo de maíz tiene aproximadamente 2 kilómetros y a unos 30 minutos de su vivienda.

La experiencia que tiene Marta, sobre el cultivo de maíz la aprendió desde pequeña, sus padres le inculcaron a aprender a cultivar maíz, como ella vive en el campo, piensa que es más factible el cultivo en época de invierno todo para producir maíz y la sostenibilidad  de su familia. Aparte de realizar la actividad de la  agricultura, se dedica a los oficios domésticos en su vivienda y para realizar  el cultivo  lo realiza junto a su esposo, que también lo apoya, el horario no es estable para trabajar, van por la mañana o por la tarde.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar insumos agrícolas: abono y el pago de  personas que le ayuden a realizar la actividad y la necesidad que será satisfecha es que su familia tendrá mejor disponibilidad de alimentación y no estar vulnerables a enfermedades.

Tener una mejor calidad de vida con su esposo y su hijos vivir en un lugar digno para sus hijos, y que ellos sean personas de bien, que terminen sus estudios universitarios y que sean profesionales con la ayuda de Dios y el sacrificio de ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
Marta, 39 years old, is married. She can neither read nor write. Her husband is a bricklayer and she is a homemaker. They have two children together: one five-year-old son and a sixteen-year-old daughter who is in eighth grade. The children do not currently work, but are full-time students. The distance from their home to their corn plantation is about two kilometers, or a thirty minute walk.

Marta learned how to grow corn from her parents when she was a very young child and has a great deal of experience. As she lives in the country, growing corn is the most viable crop in the winter to maintain the family. Apart from farming, she takes care of the household chores. She and her husband take care of the crops together. Their working schedule is not fixed; they may go in the morning or in the afternoon.

The loan that she is seeking through Fundación Campo (Countryside Foundation) is to buy agricultural supplies, including fertilizer and labor expenses. For her family, this will mean greater availability of food and less vulnerability to disease.

Marta dreams of a better life for her husband and children, of making a decent home for her children, and of them growing up to be people of means, finishing their university studies, and becoming professionals. She hopes to achieve all of this with the help of God and sacrifice from herself and her husband.

loans.use: buy materials and labor for farming.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es: Luis se caracteriza por ser un señor dinámico y emprendedor; a sus 58 años de edad es empleado de una empresa de alarmas y, alterna su empleo con la venta de electrodomésticos de manera independiente, con el fin de complementar los ingresos con los cuales lleva el sustento a su hogar. Su empuje y dedicación le han permitido salir adelante, con las ganancias de las ventas de sus productos comenzó a ahorrar y, hoy en día ya tiene su propio apartamento que construyó poco a poco y una moto que le facilita el desplazamiento hacia los diferentes lugares de la ciudad donde presta su servicio. Actualmente solicita el crédito para invertirlo en el fortalecimiento de su negocio, con el dinero desea comprar mercancía al por mayor (cámaras digitales, celulares y teléfonos) de esta forma podrá abastecerse para la temporada navideña e incrementar sus ventas, dando como resultado un mejoramiento notable en las condiciones de vida de su familia. Luis sueña con seguir acreditando su negocio y hacerlo crecer para que sea rentable y sostenible en el tiempo y, en un futuro cercano le permita ofrecer oportunidades de empleo a otras personas.
texts.en:
Luis is a dynamic and enterprising man. He is 58 years of age and works in an alarm company. He alternates this job with his own independent work, selling electrical goods to supplement his income and provide for his family. His drive and dedication have allowed him to get ahead in life. He started saving using the income he received from the sale of his products, and nowadays has his own apartment which he built little by little, as well as a motorcycle which allows him to move to the different areas of the city in which he works. 

Luis has requested this loan to strengthen his business, and plans to use the money to buy wholesale merchandise (digital cameras, phones and cellphones). In this way he will be able to buy supplies for the Christmas period and increase his sales, which will bring about a notable improvement in living conditions for him and his family. Luis dreams of continuing to grow his business so that it is profitable and sustainable over time which, in the not-so-distant future, will allow him to offer job opportunities to other people.

loans.use: To buy wholesale merchandise (digital cameras, phones and cellphones).

loans.name: Tsetsegee

texts.en:
Mrs. Tsetsegee, 64 years old, lives with her husband, daughter, and granddaughter in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. 

She has been transporting people using her minivan since 2001. Her husband has retired from work and gets a state pension. Her daughter has a position as traffic regulator at the bus station. Her granddaughter studies at a university. 

Tsetsegee is requesting a loan of MNT 2,000,000 to pay her granddaughter's tuition fee. The borrower thinks investment in education is the best thing she can do for her granddaughter.

loans.use: to pay her granddaughter's tuition fee

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: El señor Edwin  es una joven emprendedor y trabajador, actualmente vive en la casa de sus papas y sus tres hermanos, Edwin es un gran apoyo para sus papas ya que ayuda con los gastos de sus casa, el señor Edwin se dedica  desde sus 19 años al trabajo de la elaboración de calzados, en el taller de su tío, el tío al ver la habilidad del señor Edwin lo motivo para que pase cursos de elaboración de calzados, llegando a obtener el grado de técnico en la elaboración de calzados. Poco a poco el señor Edwin se compró sus máquinas de trabajo y armo su micro empresa de elaboración de calzados deportivos. Por la calidad y puntualidad de su trabajo, el señor Edwin se abrió mercado y se consolido en área local.  El crédito que solicita el señor Edwin es para la compra de máquinas y materiales, así incrementar su producción y crecer exportando a otros departamentos del país.
texts.en:
Edwin is an enterprising, hard-working young man. He currently lives at home with his parents and three siblings. Edwin is a big support for his parents as he helps with the household expenses. Since he was 19 years old, Edwin has worked at making shoes in his uncle's shop. His uncle, upon seeing Edwin's ability, urged him to pass his classes for shoe-making, and ultimately Edwin earned his technical certification in shoe-making. 

A little at a time, Edwin bought machines for his work and built up his small business making sports shoes. Thanks to the quality and punctuality of his work, Edwin created and consolidated market space in his local area. The loan that he is requesting will be used to buy machines and materials, thus expanding his production and growing to export to other departments in the country.

loans.use: buy machinery and materials to make shoes

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: El señor Alfredo es soltero, no tiene hijos dependientes de sus ingresos. Es trabajador independiente, con estudios hasta el bachillerato, es muy dedicada a su trabajo y responsable de sus obligaciones, desde los 17 años trabajo en el campo de albañil y plomería ya que desde esa edad se independizo de sus padres. tiene experiencia en el sector de plomería, obtiene trabajo junto a su hermano quien le ayudo a surgir en este ámbito. El señor Alfredo como ya tiene experiencia hay oportunidades en las que el realiza el trabajo por contrato y genera mucho mejor los ingresos personales, por lo que solicita un crédito  para  la construcción de su vivienda y para la cual requiere mayor inversión en la construcción y de esta manera el señor Alfredo mejorara su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alfredo is single; he does not have any children dependent upon his income. He is an independent worker who studied up to high school. He is very dedicated to his work and responsible with his obligations. From the age of seventeen he has worked in the field of masonry and plumbing, as he became independent from his parents at that age. He has experience in the plumbing sector; he gets work together with his brother, who helped him break into this realm.

As Alfredo already has experience, there are opportunities for him to do work on contract, and the personal income he generates is much better. He is therefore asking for a loan for the construction of his home, for which he requires a greater investment in the construction. In this way, Alfredo will improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to build a home

loans.name: Wena

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Wena works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Wena is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials like a fishing net, bamboo, wood, etc. for her fishing business.

Wena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials like a fishing net, bamboo, wood, etc.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing materials for her business.

Gina has been in this business for four years. Gina not only fishes herself, but earns more income from buying and selling fish.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing materials for her business

loans.name: May

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, May works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines, and she also earns income from a general store.  May is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional bananas for her banana business.

May has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas for her business

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is 46 years old and married.  She has four children, two of whom are in school.

Jona is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jona has been raising pigs for eleven years now.  She has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jona would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ancheta

texts.en:
Ancheta is 58 years old and widowed with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippine peso) loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like coffee, milk, sugar, soap, and soft drinks.

Ancheta has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish.

Ancheta aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like coffee, milk, sugar, soap, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Feil

texts.en:
Feil works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a 21,000 PHP (Philippine peso) loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. She has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Feil would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Elnora

texts.en:
Elnora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippine peso) through NWTF to buy materials for her tailoring business.

Elnora has been in this business for 12 years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Elnora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for her dressmaking business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines, and she also earns income from buying and selling dried fish. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen works hard to support four children. She is married and has a business raising livestock in the Philippines.

Ellen has requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a backup light in case of emergency.

Ellen is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 53 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. 

Perla is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippine pesos) through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been pig fattening for three years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

Perla is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 50 years old and married, with two children.

She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Clarita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Clarita has been fattening pigs for 10 years, and she also earns income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: José Inés

texts.es:
José de 56 años, no estudio pero si sabe leer y escribir, aprendió en programas de alfabetización para personas adultas. Él es casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, ellos tienen 4 hijos pero ya están mayores y casados, en su vivienda conviven con 6 nietos una niña de 16 años que estudia octavo grado, un niño de 5 años y otro de 3 años y dos niños de 2 años cada uno.
   
José se dedica a la agricultura, desde pequeño sus padres le enseñaron, esta actividad en la época de cultivo que es en el invierno solo se dedica a esa actividad; pero en época seca (verano) se dedica a trabajos de jornalero, la distancia del cultivo a su vivienda está a 2 kilómetros aproximadamente se tarda como 30 minutos de su casa al lugar de cultivo, y para realizar los trabajos de la agricultura lo apoyan sus hijos mayores y su esposa.

 El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar 2 sacos de abono y para pagarles a personas que le ayudaran a trabajar en el cultivo. Tendrá mayor producción de granos básicos, para la necesidad alimentaria  que les durara para el resto del verano entrante.

Su deseo, es vivir en un hogar cómodamente junto a su familia y sus nietos y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida y sobre todo estar en paz con Dios  y que sus nietos puedan sacar sus estudios y carreras universitarias, para que sean profesionales y las ganancias del cultivo lo utilizara para comprar alimento de otros derivados que él no cultiva.
texts.en:
Fifty-six-year-old José did not go to school, but he knows how to read and write; he learned from adult literacy programs.  He is married and his wife is a homemaker.  They have four children, but they are already grown up and married.  At home they live with six grandchildren; a 16-year-old girl in eighth grade, a five-year-old boy, another three-year-old boy, and two boys who are each two years old. 

José farms for a living.  His parents taught him from a very young age.  During the cultivation season, which is in the winter, this is the only work he does.  However, during the dry season (summer) he works as a laborer.  His crops are approximately 2 km from his home and it takes him 30 minutes to get from his home to his land.  His older children and his wife help him with the farm work.  
   
The loan he is requesting is to buy two sacks of fertilizer and to pay people to help him work on his crops.  He will produce more staple grains to cover their food needs and last them through the end of the coming summer.  

His wish is to live comfortably with his family and his grandchildren and to offer them a better quality of life and above all to be at peace with God.  He also wants his grandchildren to be able to go to school and to get university degrees so they will be professionals.  He will use the profits from his crops to buy different kinds of food that he does not grow.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of fertilizer and to pay people to help him with his crops

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is applying for a loan of $1000.00 to improve her business and this is her first loan. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as onions, garlic and vegetables.
Marcelina opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $200.00. She is earning a good income and will use the income to support her family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy onions, garlic and vegetables

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg, 39, lives with her husband, son and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running a cafeteria since 2007. Her husband works as a heavy engine serviceman for a mining company outside Ulaanbaatar. After twenty days of hard work, he comes back home for ten days.

In order to contribute to the family’s income Oyunchimeg’s husband wants to operate a taxi during his ten days in Ulaanbaatar. She is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT through Credit Mongol to buy an electric car for her husband to use as a taxi. She would like the car to be electric as it has cleaner emissions and wastes less fuel.

loans.use: to buy an electric car

loans.name: Mina

texts.en:
Mina is 49 years old and married with four children.

Mina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

Mina has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Mina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel works hard to support her family. She is single and for nine years has had a food vending business in the Philippines.

Liezel is applying for a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production. She would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her street food.

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
Keller Psychological Associates, PA, was a corporation of “two psychologists offering testing, therapy, and other mental health related services to the Keller and Southlake areas” in Texas, according to the website, www.kellerpsych.com. However, when Dr. Ray’s partner closed his office, Ray was left to carry on the practice alone.

According to the site, Ray, who is a clinical psychologist, offers his services with five years of graduate training in psychology.  His background includes stints at the Children’s Medical Center in Tulsa, Oklahoma, and a fellowship in pediatric neuropsychology at the University of Miami Medical School.

Ray specializes in neuropsychological testing, individual therapy, parent training, and behavior management. A full list of services he offers is on his website. 

Because of the recent change within his business, Ray needed his own office to work in. He found an office, went to the bank for a loan, and then learned about nonprofit microlender, Accion Texas Inc. Once he applied and was approved, Ray used the loan to cover remodeling costs and other business expenses which will help reduce debt. 

Ray says the absence of a loan could have resulted in suspension of his practice.

loans.use: to finance an office by covering remodeling costs and other business expenses.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Minda works hard to support her family. She buys and sells rice in the Philippines as well as farming it.

Minda has been sustaining her rice business with help from her past fourteen loans from NWTF. She is applying now for a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional rice to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional rice to sell

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ritchel is 37 years old and has three children who are in school.

Ritchel has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Ritchel has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fertilizer in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of fertilizer to sell for her business buying and selling fertilizer.

Leonora has been in this business for one year. She earns more income from direct selling educational books.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to buy more farmland in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of fertilizer to sell

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 58 years old and single.

Raquel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Raquel has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from tailoring.

Raquel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: CHEIKH est marchand ambulant, il est marié et père de famille. Il est à son 2eme prêt et veut renforcer son fond de commerce. Comme vous le voyez sur la photo il vend des chaussures pour enfants, des sacs et soutien- gorge et ca depuis plus de 7ans.  Il prend en charges les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. CHEIKH quitte sa maison à 8h du matin pour y revenir vers les environs de 19h. Il a comme projet futur d’avoir un grand magasin pour pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa petite famille.
texts.en: Cheikh is a traveling salesman. He is a married father. He is on his second loan and wants to reinforce his business. As you see in the photo, he sells children’s shoes, purses, and bras, and he’s been doing this for more than 7 years. He is responsible for his family’s daily expenses and his children’s school fees. Cheikh leaves his house at 8am and comes home at about 7pm. In the future, he’d like to open a big store to be able to increase his profits and to improve the living conditions of his little family.

loans.use: to buy and sell children’s shoes, purses, and bras

loans.name: Salamata Samba

texts.fr:
Madame SALAMATA  est une dame âgée de 48 ans, célibataire sans enfant. Elle s’active dans le commerce depuis plus de 05 ans maintenant, car elle a démarré dès l’âge très jeune. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 17h.  Elle est à son 3ème crédit à l’IMCEC et aimerait avoir un renouvellement pour  acheter de la marchandise et satisfaire sa clientèle. Avec le crédit, elle va se procurer des savons en poudre, du lait, de l’huile, des bonbons clémentine qu’elle va revendre dans le voisinage.
SALAMATA n’a pas de charges et travaille pour diversifier les produits et services. Et cela, elle le fait pour  subvenir à ses besoins, parfois elle participe à la facture d’électricité de sa famille. A l’avenir elle souhaite avoir une place au marché et augmenter son  stock de marchandises
texts.en: Mrs. Salamata is a 48-year-old lady who is single with no children. She has been selling things for more than 5 years, since she got started at a very young age. She starts her day at 8am and finishes it at 5pm. She is on her 3rd loan at IMCEC and would like to have it renewed to buy merchandise to satisfy her clientele. With this loan, she is going to get some powdered soap, milk, oil, and orange candy, which she will sell in the neighborhood. Salamata has nobody under her care and works to be able to diversify her products and services. She does this to meet her needs, and sometimes to help pay for her family’s electricity bill. In the future, she hopes to have a place at the market and to increase her merchandise stock.

loans.use: to buy sugar, orange candy, soap, and onions to sell

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: La Señora Nelly es una persona amable y cumplida, curso hasta la primaria, no pudo seguir con sus estudios superiores por problemas económicos, de estado civil casada, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales dependen aun de su apoyo moral y económico. La Señora Nelly  hoy solicita el presente crédito para comprar mercadería para su tienda de barrio, la tienda se encuentra ubicada en el mismo lugar donde vive hace muchos años pero ella no es propietaria de esta casa;  esta casa es de la Iglesia Cristiana en la cual su esposo es Pastor de la misma y gracias a esto tienen un techo seguro en el cual vivir. Hoy solicita el crédito para poder llenar el negocio de tienda de barrio que tiene y que además representa su principal fuente de ingresos, ya que con el crédito le permitirá concretar los deseos futuros que la Señora Nelly tiene; como el de contar con una casa propia en un futuro próximo.
texts.en:
Nelly is a friendly and accomplished person who studied up to primary school; she wasn't able to continue her higher studies due to financial problems. She is married and has three children who still depend on her for moral and financial support.

Nelly is currently asking for this loan to buy merchandise for her neighborhood store. The store is located in the same place where she has lived for many years, but she doesn't own this house. The house belongs to the Christian church where her husband is the pastor, and thanks to this they have a secure roof to live under.

She is currently asking for the loan to be able to fully stock her neighborhood store business, which is also her primary source of income. The loan will allow Nelly to make her wishes for the future –such as the wish to have her own house in the near future– come true.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her neighborhood store

loans.name: Rica

texts.en:
Rica is 30 years old and married with four children.

Rica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like eggs, milk, cream, soap, etc.

Rica has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from buying and selling coconuts.

Rica aspires to save enough money so she could send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like eggs, milk, cream, soap, etc.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 40 years old, married with nine children. Six of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Conchita has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a  40,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Conchita has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Welem

texts.en:
Welem is a 48-year-old entrepreneur. He is married to Sri, a 34-year-old housewife. They are blessed with two children: Eden, 11, first year of junior high school; Dicky, 9, fourth year of elementary school.

Welem has been running the kiosk business for fifteen years. His income from this business helps him to fulfill his family's needs and the educational expenditures of the children. Welem sees that recently the needs of his family are increasing rapidly as well as the demands of his customers. That is why he really needs to improve his business income. Therefore, he applied to TLM for an individual loan of 10,000,000 IDR (Indonesia rupiahs). The loan is spent to add more stocks needed on a daily basis for his kiosk, such as sugar, rice, soap, detergent, shampoo, etc.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks needed on a daily basis for his kiosk, such as sugar, rice, soap, detergent, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru: Айнуре 30 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Айнуры- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айнура занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 8 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айнуры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 7 дойных коров, 51 овца, а также обрабатывает земельный надел мерою 2,15 ГА, на котором ежегодно выращивают фасоль, клевер и кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход составляет 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнура обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Ainura is 30 years old and married.  She and her husband are raising three children. She has a secondary education and is involved in animal husbandry and crop farming, an activity which provides her family with its main source of income. She started in this business eight years ago with the purchase of livestock for 10,000 som (KGS).

Thanks to Ainura's hard work, her farming business now comprises seven dairy cows, 51 sheep, as well as 2.15 hectares (5.3 acres) of land on which she grows beans, clover and corn every year. She makes a monthly income of 16,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her farming business, Ainura has turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" and requested a loan of 135,000 som (KGS). She will use this loan to buy some steers in order to increase her cattle headcount.

Ainura plans to invest the earnings from this loan into further increasing her livestock headcount. She is also planning to save enough money to continue to finance her children's education.

loans.use: to buy steers.

loans.name: Tezalia

texts.es: Tezalia, de 64 años de edad, está casada con Hilario quien se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte, fruto de esa unión tiene una hija de 30 años de edad. Juntos viven cómodamente en su casa propia en compañía de sus 2 nietos a los que quieren mucho. Tezalia se dedica a la venta de comidas regionales. También da servicio de transporte de pasajeros en un mototaxi que se compró con el fruto de sus ahorros más un crédito particular, al empezar lo alquilaban pero viendo que se deterioraba muy rápidamente por el mal uso que daban a su vehículo decidió que su pareja lo conduciría para realizar el servicio. Se inició hace 04 años cuando se compró su primer vehículo y en el transcurso del tiempo fue renovando otras unidades mientras se deterioraban por el uso cotidiano ya que lo compraba usados. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual puede solventar sus gastos familiares, empezó a desarrollar esta labor por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico ya que no podía conseguir un empleo, ahora se siente con mayor seguridad. Por lo contrario comenta que no le gusta cuando su mototaxi se malogra muy seguido pues le ocasiona gastos que no planea, pero aun así logra ver buenos resultados que se muestran en sus ganancias. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le permite avanzar con el progreso de su negocio. Con el monto solicitado comprará ingredientes tales como arroz, carnes, verduras, entre otros, además se repuestos para su mototaxi.
texts.en: Tezalia is 64 years old. She is married and works in transportation service. From her marriage she has a 30 year old daughter. They live comfortably together in their own house with 2 grandchildren whom they love very much. Tezalia works selling food from the region. She also has a passenger transportation service in a motorcycle taxi that she bought with her savings plus a private loan. At first she would rent it out but when she saw how quickly it deteriorated from the misuse of her vehicle she decided that her spouse would drive it to offer the service. She started 4 years ago when she bought her first vehicle and over time she renovated other units deteriorated from daily use, because she would buy them used. She likes her business because it allows her to have income to pay for her family's expenses. She started doing this work out of a need to have some income, since she was unable to find a job. Now she feels more secure. On the other hand, she says she doesn't like it when her motorcycle taxi breaks down often because that incurs unplanned expenses. Even so, she sees good results in her earnings. At this time, she is asking for  S/. 1000. She is happy knowing that she has financial support that will allow her to advance with her business' progress. With the amount she has asked for, she will buy ingredients such as rice, meat, vegetables and more. She will also buy replacement parts for her motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, meat, vegetables, and more, as well as replacement parts for her motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Joel Manaen

texts.es:
Joel de 24 años,  estudio hasta octavo grado, es casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.  Ellos solo tienen una niña de 1 año de edad.
 
Joel se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de granos básicos maíz y frijol, se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace 3 años, el trabajo lo aprendió porque su papá se lo enseño. Viendo la situación económica que pasaba decidió dedicarse a la agricultura y antes de dedicarse a esta actividad era mecánico, la distancia de su vivienda al lugar de cultivo es  de 2 km y se tarda 30 minutos caminando, de su casa al lugar de cultivo, para el desarrollo de la actividad agrícola su esposa lo apoya en el trabajo y algunos de sus hermanos que le ayudan, el horario de trabajo no es estable él trabaja por la mañana y por la tarde.

El crédito lo utilizara para la comprar abono,  fertilizantes y pago de personas que le ayudan a realizar su trabajo. El crédito le ayudara a tener una mayor producción  de granos básicos y a una mayor recolección de la cosecha y su necesidad que tiene es aplicarle al cultivo los requerimientos para un mayor desarrollo y producción  

Espera tener una mejor calidad de vida, una vivienda digna para su familia y que sus hijos sean personas de bien como lo es él y que puedan estudiar una carrea universitaria y sean profesionales. Le ayudara a tener más suministros de alimento para la época seca y sus ganancias las utilizara para mejorar su vivienda, ampliarla y reparar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Joel is 24 years old. He went to school up to the eighth grade, and his wife takes care of the home. They have a one year old daughter. 
 
Joel works in agriculture. He grows basic grains such as corn and beans and has done this activity for 3 years. He learned this work because his father taught it to him. When he saw the economic situation, he decided to work in agriculture. Before this, he was a mechanic. His crops are 2 km from his house and it takes 30 minutes to walk there. His wife helps him do this activity as well as some of his siblings. His work schedule isn't regular and he works mornings and afternoons. 

He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and to pay people to help him do the work. The loan will help him have more production of basic grains and a bigger harvest. He needs to apply what he needs for more growth and a higher yield. 

He hopes to have a better quality of life, a worthy home for his family, and for his children to be upright people, like he is. He wants them to be able to go to college and have good careers. This will help him have more food supplies for the dry season and he will sue his earnings to improve his home and repair the roof on his house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay people to help him do his work.

loans.name: Bernarda Melfi

texts.es: La Sra. Bernarda es madre soltera, fue madre a los 18 años, desde ese tiempo tuvo que dedicarse y criar a su hijo sola, ya que no contó con el apoyo de su pareja y tampoco con el de sus familiares. Comenzó desde los 20 años la actividad de la fotografía. Los primeros 10 años era auxiliar de un estudio fotográfico. Donde aprendió poco a poco sobre esta actividad; por la cual ella fue agarrando gusto y llegando a convertir la fotografia en su pasión y también su medio de subsistencia. En la actualidad tiene su propio estudio fotográfico en el centro de la cuidad; el cual es muy concurrido, y al mismo tiempo le favorece para poder generar mayores ingresos. Necesita el credito para la compra de una impresora fotografica.
texts.en: Bernarda is a single mother. She became a mother when she was 18 and since then has raised her daughter alone, with no support from the girl's father or her family. She started photography when she was 20 years ago. For the first 10 years, she was an assistant in a photography studio where she learned about this activity little by little. She began to like it and ended up making photography into her passion and also a way to earn a living. Right now, she has her own photographic studio in the center of town. There are a lot of people that go by and that is good for her to be able to earn income. She needs the loan to buy a photograph printer.

loans.use: to buy a photo printer.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 49 years old and married with three children.

For the past five years Margie has had a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She is applying for a 8000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

In the future Margie would like to have saved enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Santos Susana

texts.es: Doña Santos de 39 años de edad se dedica a la comercialización y crianza de cerdos de  esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar es una mujer muy trabajadora, honrada y responsable, ella  ha tomado la decisión de acercarse a esta institución para solicitar un crédito para la compra de mas cerdos, vitaminas y concentrado para poder seguir con la crianza, espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una mejor ganancia con la venta de los cerdos la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en: Santos, 39, works by raising and selling pigs. This is how she makes a living and pays household expenses. She is a hard-working, honest, and responsible woman. She decided to become involved in this institution to request a loan so she can buy more pigs, vitamins, and animal feed. This will help her keep raising animals. She hopes to have positive results because she doesn't have another source of income. She trusts in God that she will be able to have a better income by selling pigs. She will allow her to keep paying her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy more pigs, vitamins, and animal feed.

loans.name: Mylen

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mylen works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food vending. Mylen is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional dried fish to sell for her buy and sell dried fish business.

Mylen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Dashdeleg

texts.en: Mr. Dashdeleg, 24 years old, lives with his mother and sister in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in an old house on a plot of land surrounded by an iron gate. He has been working as a crane operator for a mining company since 2011. His mother has retired from work and gets a state pension. His sister has the position of overseer in a billiard center. He is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cements, fiberglass and foam in order to renovate his house. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and fewer pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia de 61 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, Alicia es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Ella posee una tienda de productos comestibles como pan, refrescos, aceites, verduras, frutas, golosinas y también de primera necesidad como: jabón y shampoo entre otras cosas, tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación. Alicia solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir aún más la tienda de manera que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y de esta misma forma mejorar sus ventas lo cual es su prioridad para sacar adelante su hogar.
texts.en: Alicia, 61, lives in her own home with her husband and daughter. Alicia is a very responsible and hard-working person who has been able to move her family forward. She has a store to sell groceries such as bread, drinks, cooking oil, vegetables, fruit, soft drinks, and other basic necessity items like soap and shampoo. Her business is located in her home. Alicia is requesting a loan so that she can stock up her store even more. This will allow her to attend to more customers and also improve her sales, which is her priority to move her household forward.

loans.use: to buy bread, drinks, cooking oil, vegetables, fruit, soft drinks, soap, and shampoo.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 49 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Helen is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

Helen has been raising livestock for two years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
María de 54 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos, el hijo trabaja y la hija no porque es discapacitada. María solo pudo estudiar hasta 6°grado, con ella viven tres personas mas y solo su hija depende de ella.

María tiene 21 años de dedicarce a la venta de comida, aprendio trabajado en una pupuseria. Hoy en dia, vende puspusas y sopas, antes solo vendia tamales y minutas; tambien hace horas de trabajo en la alcaldia de la comunidad, desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde, despues llega a su casa a atender su negocio.

El prestamo sera utilizado para comprar una planacha para pupusas, la que tiene esta en mal estado y necesita cambiarla, tambien tiene que reparar las instalaciones donde vende su producto.
María espera seguir trabajando fuertemente, para poder mantener a su hija que por el momenteo no tiene a nadie mas que la apoye.
texts.en:
María is 54 years old.  She is single and has two children.  Her son works but her daughter does not, as she is disabled.  María was only able to complete up to the end of sixth grade.  Three other people live with María.  Her daughter is the only person that depends on María.

For 21 years María has made a living selling food.  She learned this work at a restaurant specialising in "pupusas" (thick, corn-stuffed tortillas).  María now sells "pupusas" and soups, though before she only sold "tamales" (a corn-based dish) and shaved ice snacks.  María also works at the local community's town hall from 6am until 4pm and then goes home to run her business.

This loan will be used to buy a grill for making the "pupusas", as the one she currently has is in a bad condition and needing replaced.  She will also use the loan to repair some of the fittings where she sells her product.

María hopes to continue working hard so as to maintain her daughter.  She currently does not have anyone else to support her.

loans.use: to buy a grill for making "pupusas" (corn-stuffed tortillas) and to repair fittings where she sells her product.

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn is 26 years old and single.

Noralyn works hard to provide for her nephews. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been running the general store for four years and also earns additional income from poultry.

Noralyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, milk, eggs, noodles, etc for her general store business.

Rebecca has been in this business for 19 years. Rebecca earns more income from pig fattening.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, milk, eggs, noodles, etc

loans.name: Carla

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Carla works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling coconut. Carla is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her buy and sell charcoal business.

Carla has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Olinda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Olinda de 62 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene una hija, que es independiente y tiene su propia familia. No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, vive unicamente con su esposo que trabaja en la construccion como albañil.

Olinda tiene 32 años de trabajar vendiendo pupusas y tamales, aprendio de su madre que era una gran cocinera, cuando necesita material, se levanta a las 5 de la mañana viaja 5 kilometros a la ciudad para comprar los materiales que necesita, para la elaboracion de sus productos, una vez listo los vende a pie en su comunidad.

El préstamo sera usado para comprar maíz en grano para elaborar pasteles de carne, pollo o de papas y tambien tamales, asegura que es una actividad que le da buenos resultados.

Olinda espera que con su trabajo, siga mejorando su calidad de vida, espera ser un apoyo para su nieta y con esfuerzo darle el estudio.
texts.en:
Olinda is 62 years old, has a partner and has one daughter.  Her daughter is now independent and has her own family.  Olinda did not have the opportunity to study.  She lives with only her husband, who works as a builder.

Olinda has been working selling "tamales" (a traditional corn dish) and "pupusas" (thick, corn-stuffed tortillas)  for 32 years.  She learned this trade from her mother, who was a great cook.  When Olinda needs to buy supplies she wakes up at 5am and travels 5 kilometres to the city in order to buy them.  Once she has prepared her products she sells them on foot in her community.  

This loan will be used to buy corn in order to make meat, chicken, and potato pastries, as well as "tamales".  Olinda assures us that this work gives good profits.

Olinda hopes that, with her work, she can continue improving her quality of life.  She hopes to support her granddaughter and, with a lot of effort, provide her with an education.

loans.use: to buy corn in order to make meat, chicken, and potato pastries, as well as "tamales" (a traditional corn dish).

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es:
La señora Felicidad tiene 30 años de edad, vive con su esposo en casa de su hermana en una vivienda rustica, tiene 3 hijos,  su domicilio está ubicado en la urbanización la Hoyada de nuestra  Ciudad de Monteagudo. Sus principal actividad de la señora Felicidad  son trabajos de sastrería en tela donde confecciona ropa deportiva, de vestir y otros arreglos en general, esta actividad lo realiza en su propio domicilio donde vive, su conyugue percibe ingresos de los trabajos de albañil.
La señora Felicidad junto a su esposo trabajan arduamente para poder obtener ingresos y cubrir gastos de estudios de sus hijos,  es por eso que está solicitando crédito para la compra de materias primas como tela e hilos para la fabricación de prendas de vestir y así  obtener ingresos y así puedan continuar estudiando sus hijos y también construir su propia casa que tanta falta lo hace y de esta manera tener un techo donde vivir.
texts.en:
Felicidad is 30 years old.  She lives with her husband, in her sister's rustic home.  Felicidad has three children and her home is in the La Hoyada de Nuestra urbanisation, in the city of Monteagudo.  Felicidad's main work is dressmaking - she produces sports clothes, smart clothes, and does repairs.  She does this work from home.  Felicidad's partner earns an income as a builder.

Alongside her husband, Felicidad works hard in order to earn an income and cover household costs and the fees for her children's education.  This is why she is applying for a loan in order to buy supplies such as material and threads to make clothes.  With this she will earn an income and her children will be able to continue studying.  She will also be able to build her own house, something which she is very much lacking.  This loan will give Felicidad her own roof above her head.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies, such as materials and threads, in order to make clothes.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, soap, spices, etc. for her general store business.

Melinda has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from food vending.

Melinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, soap, spices, etc.

loans.name: Jemma

texts.en:
Jemma is 47 years old and married with four children who are all in school. Jemma works very hard to provide for them.

Jemma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Jemma has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, sardines, spices and other groceries. 

In the future, Jemma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Aiza works hard to support her family.

Aiza has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling crabs and shells. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her business buying and selling fish.

Aiza has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Diego

texts.en: Diego, a Tlaxcalan farmer, raises sheep and milks cows as his primary source of income. He is always looking for ways to improve his farm, either through technology or by implementing better practices. He is investing in a six-cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester because it meets both of those goals. He will treat the sheep and cow manure with his digester to produce renewable biogas and potent biofertilizer, allowing him to displace fossil fuel based energy sources and agrochemical fertilizer on his farm. This shift will result in both economic and environmental benefits. The loan represents 46% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: José Ernesto

texts.es:
José de 29 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene 1 hija de 11 años de edad que estudia 3° grado. Él solo pudo estudiar hasta 9° grado, su esposa es ama de casa y con él conviven solo su esposa e hija.

José es motista de un camion, traslada materiales de construcción, tiene 6 años de dedicarce a este oficio que aprendio de su padre, quien tenia camiones de volteo. Antes José era carpintero, pero hoy en dia su trabajo es mas constante y le da mejores ganancias.

El préstamo sera usado para pagar un documento de escritura de una propiedad de la madre de José, debido a que ella es de pocos recursos y José se ofrecio a pagarle la legalidad de la propiedad al abogado que hara la escritura.

El sueño de José es comprar un camión nuevo y contratar a alguien para que pueda dar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
José, 29, is in a common-law marriage and has one 11-year-old daughter who is in third grade. He was only able to study through ninth grade himself. His wife works in the home. Only his wife and daughter live with him.

José is a truck driver who transports construction materials. He has had this job for six years. He learned the skills from his father, who used to have dump trucks. Before, José was a carpenter but now his work is steadier and he earns more income.

He will use this loan to pay for written property papers for his mother's property. She doesn't have many resources and José offered to pay for the legal papers for the property and the lawyer will write them up.

José's dream is to buy a new truck and contract with someone so he can provide a better services.

loans.use: to pay for written property papers and pay for a lawyer.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Cynthia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Cynthia is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Cynthia has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 44 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rebecca has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Andrés

texts.en: Andrés, a Tlaxcalan farmer, finds technology fascinating and more so when it allows him to reduce his operating costs while concurrently helping the environment. He is investing in a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to treat the animal waste produced on his farm. One of the resultant products, renewable biogas, will allow him to reduce how much he spends on the fossil-fuel based LP gas his family currently uses to cook and heat bathwater. The other product generated by his digester, potent biofertilizer, will allow him to improve his crop yields without having to spend on expensive agrochemical fertilizer. This loan represents 46% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester for his farm.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 64 years old and is married.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Nora is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nora has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Tsoggerel

texts.en:
Mr. Tsoggerel, 50 years old, lives with his wife, father and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as an electrician at a power station since 2012. His wife has a position of book keeper at a private firm. His daughter studies at a university in Korea and his son goes to high school. His father has retired from work and gets state pension.

He is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to buy an electric car. The advantage of an electric car is that it contributes to a cleaner air in cities because it produces no harmful pollution at the tailpipe from the on board source of power, such as particulates (soot), volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, and various oxides of nitrogen. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy an electric car.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
Marisol is 37 years old and married with two children.

Marisol works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, such as soaps, milk, eggs, spices, chips, etc.

Marisol has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years, and earns an income from pre-paid mobile loads.

Marisol aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, such as soaps, milk, eggs, spices, chips, etc.

loans.name: 04-12-11-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hải has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to maintain the refreshment bar (Small bar with coffee, tea, soft drink, and fast food).

Hải is 36 years old and married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 04-12-11-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 
Hải lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
